text: Great establishment Fast food Authentic Wonderful service. Damien was my server wonderful service, funny dude will return.
Chashu (if i remember it right) soup base was good, the pork super tasty. Staff are very friendly.

Stopped in here with my wife and son and was very impressed. Although we were literally the only customers here (right before closing), it was a pretty impressive little spot nicely located near Torrey Pines and Charleston. I had bulgogi noodles that were very flavorful and also shared mixed tempura plate and additional plate of shrimp tempura.  The veggies were perfectly soft and the tempura batter was absolutely perfect!! I have never had such a flavorful dipping sauce that tasted like soy sauce perfectly infused with the right amount of ginger!!! Will definitely be back here again!!!!
Nice modern atmosphere. Damian was awesome! He made me feel welcome, and the ramen was great. Hopefully next time I have room for dessert

I've never left a Yelp review, so we'll see how this goes.

Food:

I ordered chashu ramen with soft boiled egg (+$1.00). The ramen broth was fine, it was definitely tasty but I would say it was a far stretch from exceptional.

The noodles were sub-par. I felt at times as if I was eating top ramen noodles with a more quality broth -- at this price, no matter how relatively cheap it is compared to other Vegas ramen bars, this is unacceptable.

Toppings are very important to ramen, and I feel this is where Moko falls short the most. The only topping I recieved was 3 slices of pork belly and the additional egg I ordered. Granted, I could have ordered more toppings, but that would have quickly increased the price. I understand that the $8.50 bowl of ramen is cheaper than most other ramen bars, but if I have to add several dollars worth of toppings, the low starting price doesn't help. 
As for the taste of the toppings, the meat was truly delicious. There was a subtle char to it that really set it over the edge. The egg was a different story. It didn't taste bad, but the creamy center of the egg was noticeably cold. It was clear that it was in no way fresh.

Overall the food was not excellent but was palatable.

The nail in Moko's coffin was the service.

I had to wait at least 45 minutes for my bowl of ramen, and they had forgot to even start my to go order, so I ended up just canceling it. Water refills were rare, and the taste or overall freshness of the food in no way justified the slow service especially considering there were only two other people eating at the time I was there.

Overall, the food was alright and the slow service was unjustifiable. I don't plan on returning.

I went here based on Yelp reviews and found the food to be absolutely delicious.  The portions are on the small side, but they are infused with such tasteful ingredients and perfectly prepared.  I went during the week and had no problem getting a seat right away and the service is so very, very friendly but professional.

Between going out for pho and going out for ramen, pho is usually my go to when it comes to noodle soups. However, Moko Ramen changed my attitude in a hurry. I've now frequented this restaurant several times and it's one of my (and my friends') favorite places to go. 

The restaurant itself is a smallish place with a bar and around a handful of tables, so it can get somewhat busy during dinner time, however I've never had to wait for a table. It's simply decorated, but very clean and stylish looking. Servers are friendly and attentive. Music is always good too! 

The food is the real magic of this place though. I've had the curry ramen more times than I can count and my friends swear by the chashu ramen. If you're not into any of the "pre-planned" ramens, you can also make your own from a list of ingredients - just check off what you want on a paper menu they provide. I will say that making your own can get pricey quickly, so I suggest just picking a pre-planned one and adding any ingredients you want to that instead. 

Regardless of what you order, there's always a lot of it and all high quality. Moko is probably my favorite restaurant in Vegas, thus far, and you can be sure that I'll be back very soon!

I love the curried vegetarian ramen. It blew my mind the first time I wandered in and now I travel all the way from the east side just to  eat here. I loved it so much I brought all my ramen snob friends too and they loved it. Seriously, I dream about the perfection of their noodles. Also the spinach noodles in the vegan ramen are the best things ever.

AMAZING ramen, they also have a nice selection of non-ramen food too. The ambience is good for a date or even a group hang, the costumer service is great and the owner is awesome. Overall this has become my favorite ramen place, hands down!
I am not sure how this place got 4.5 Stars. The service is bad. Don't get me started on food. Probably the worse katsu chicken I ever had. Those great reviews must be written by friends or family.

Whatever you do, DON'T order on Yelp or Grub Hub. They do not fulfill orders on these apps even though they are advertised. I've waited over an hour for food since ordering on the application.
If you don't want mobile application orders then remove yourself from these platforms!!!!
So annoyed at this as I now have to deal with getting my money back from the online order.

Expensive and small portions! Im a server and bartender . I went with my friend because of the great reviews but the reviews were obviously made by friends of the employees... The food tasted great but it was SMALL portions. $ 12 a plate for two bites small! ( I'm a lite eater and only weigh 100 pounds so when I say small I mean SMALL!) 
Wine was not on the list but we ordered it anyways.. It was 120$!?!? 
Still hungry after paying so much was insane! 
Server was very very nice and helpful and took off half the price for the wine so the bill came out to around 100 dollars. 
Good and service was phenomenal but it was soooo expensive. I don't recommend.

Great food and great atmosphere. Like the simplistic of the entrees and appetizers. Must try 30 hours Sous Vide Berkshire Pork Belly!!! Unexpected flavor combos that taste amazing! If your big fan of kimchi try "Kimchi Pasta with Smoked Mackerel" Nice selection of beers as well. Well done!!!
It was open on new year eve so thought we'd try it out and it ended up being great! I recommend a bento box! Owner waited on our table himself and was really nice!

I rarely Yelp anymore since Vegas just isn't a good city for it, but I felt compelled to share about my experience here because the food and service are amazing and people need to hear about it. This place needs to be in Chinatown or on Eastern. Not enough people have experienced it. Moko serves Korean Fusion tapas. So if you like Korean food and/or tapas, you'll love this. We had the 10 hour braised pork belly, beef tataki, spicy popcorn chicken, chicken pottage, seated yellowtail salad, surf and turf roll, black bean noodles, and dessert was green tea mochi ice cream on the house. Everything was delicious. I personally liked the surf and turf roll and black bean noodles the most. Every dish was prepared and plated beautifully and the owner was very kind and polite. I highly recommend this place.

This is probably the worse experience I've ever encountered. Food came out uncooked and another one was wayyy to spicy. Spoke to the owner and he said "theirs nothing he could do". Not switch my bowl or not charge me for the bowls that were too uncooked. This is unprofessional, and horrible customer service. Owner should be ashamed of himself!

Excellent chashu ramen! Broth, noodle texture and pork, yummy!
Chicken kariage delish...!
Owner was really nice too... Cooking himself, so homemade:)
Check in to get free ice cream!!
Delicious !!!!

This was our second visit to Moko which is a hidden gem of a restaurant that serves small plates. The food and service was excellent with special attention from the owner Ryan. Our server Serah was a cute as can be. We started off with the seaweed salad and the beef gyoza. The gyoza had a light crispy wrapper and a very tasty hoisin based dipping sauce that had some kick to it, this was the best gyoza I ever had. Next came the beef tacos which was good but not something I would order the next time here. We followed that with the fiery noodles which lived up to it's name and was definitely worth coming back for. We finished the meal with the Chilean sea bass which was good with the spicy vegetable sauce. For our beverage we ordered the Soju which is like a cold sake that went well with our entrees. The restaurant is small and located in a strip mall across from CSN and isn't very visible when you drive by, and is sandwiched between a McDonalds and a Chipotle, which can account for the fact that both times we came here there were only a couple of other patrons. But overall we will definitely be back to try more of their dishes.

First of all, beware of a lot of the photos posted on Yelp because Moko is no longer a tapas restaurant. This place is a ramen bar & they offer a nice variety at that. Like all ramen spots, you can choose which type of broth you want, but I like how they have different noodle options (including spinach noodles for vegans). I ordered takoyaki, which was delicious, & a miso ramen bowl with thin noodles -- the broth was full of flavor. Although our server initially forgot about my appetizer order, he was very quick & attentive. Definitely worth stopping by if you're craving ramen.
Amazing vegetarian ramen! One of the best spots I've gone to! Service was great! I would definitely take friends and family here!

Hidden Gem on Charleston and Torrey Pines area.
Good service
Great food 

Worth a shot if you are looking for something different but in the mood for Ramen.

Try out their Happy Hour prices! Will recommend to friends and family!
Excellent food for a very fair price. The food is somewhat slow coming out of the kitchen, but it is always served hot and is very tasty

Some of the best Asian Bistro Tapas Place I have ever been. The food is spectacular and the ambiance is amazing. The owner Ryan is very good at seeking to offer a high class experience. 

Every time I go in a new dish is presented to me and I am impressed every time.

I can see the details in every part of the store.

I just discovered ramen recently and fell in love!  We have our favorite place back in Utah and found a close second out here, but it is across the valley from our house. We decided to try this place out since it is closer to where we lived. We were not impressed with the ramen at all. The pork did not seem like it was slow cooked like it typically is...it did not melt in the mouth like it does in the other Ravens I have tried. The broth did not have the typical big flavor and they only had chili powder to put on (no oil or even soy sauce). This place just did not have the typical ramen umami flavor I am used to. 

I am giving it 2 stars because it was a good atmosphere and the service was decent. I wish I loved it like other reviewers!  The search for a closer ramen house will continue, but we will not be going back here.
This place is really good and has a good vibe. The owner is super friendly. Had the chicken udon one of the best I have had in vegas so far noodles where perfect.

So far all the dishes we have tried: eggplant salad, spicy chicken wing, black bean noodle, short ribs, shrimp risotto,  beef tataki & surf & turf roll was excellent! The creme brulle dessert is so delish.  We are definitely coming back to try the 30 hour marinate pork belly. Great service, nice atmosphere & i love the music they play.

Go see Ryan he is the absolute best. And try the Mu Sake. Came here and he is really great and the food is great. Nice place for some tapas and a few drinks. The prices are amazingly reasonable and you get a lot of food. You will not be disappointed.
Delicious takoyaki and well made bibimbap, will definitely come here again. The waitress was very nice and responsive and took card of me very well.
Small place on Charleston, south of Rainbow, a trendy Korean tapas bar!  Good service & clean. 'Had a delicious hot stone pot of rice- bibimbap- tasty !!!
What a cute place!  The employees were so friendly and the food was awesome. I would go back.

Not too shabby. I got the Takoyaki which I loved and I also had the Tonkutso Shoyu ramen which had NO meat in it. I was surprised at that since all the other ramen places I've been too have meat in their Tonkutso ramen. The noodles I didn't care for as I like thicker noodles and the broth didn't have as much taste.

Went for the second time last weekend and had another great experience. Was pleasantly surprised to see that the prices went down a little! Food was excellent and prepared perfectly. I particularly enjoyed the shrimp risotto and the Surf and Turf. Stone IPA and Fat Tire on draft, pretty much you can order 5-6 dishes with a couple beers and walk out happy and satisfied

Moko is very tastefully decorated.  The ambiance is upscale, yet casual.  The service was impeccable, and the food was nothing short of amazing.  
We ordered the original chicken tempura and sesame chicken teriyaki from the lunch menu, which came with salad, broccoli, cucumbers, rice, and mochi all for $13.  Look for the Prix Fixe deal!
We also tried the kimchi bacon fried rice, seared yellowtail salad, and spicy shin ramyun noodle soup.  All this plus a 24 oz. Stone IPA draft beer, and the bill was under $50.  
I can't even find the words to express how delicious the chicken, fried rice and yellowtail salad were.  Good thing I took photos.  I'm going back next week to try the marinated pork belly.
All I know is, my custom soup was awesome today! Waitress was super nice as well. Cute place!

We walked in at 8:47pm and the guy says they're closed and last call was 8:45pm. Yelp says you close at 10pm and even if it's supposed to say 9pm you're saying you can't serve us a to go order? This was our first time coming here but I can't stand it when you're more focused and closing up than providing customer service.

The Ramen isn't traditional, their signature ramen dishes were very lack luster. Their soups were very simple and lacked flavor. It's far to expensive for what it's worth. The service was at best 6/10, and the environment in the restaurant was pleasing. overall the restaurant is nice but their ramen overrated and very simplistic.

Omg this place is absolutely amazing! We were celebrating my boyfriends success and we tried going to raku with no reservation and the wait was an hour long. So we decided to yelp some restaurants and came across this place. All I gotta say is thank god! It's a quaint little restaurant but the decor is perfect for those romantic evenings.  There were a only a few people at the bar when we came. But the service was wonderful, come to find out Ryan is the owner. :) He recommended some delicious plates and he also has stone ipa on tap! 

Try the surf and turf and pork belly! It's like a flavorful explosion in your mouth! Everything was great and the price isn't that bad since its a tapas restaurant. Didn't get to try the creme brûlée everyone was raving about because they were out, but that's just more of incentive for me to come back! And I will be back! 



Ryan was awesome! Got to chit chat with him since everyone else left before we were done. This place will probably be my new hang out to enjoy great food and beer. They just started happy hour from 5-7 too!

I will absolutely go back here every time I'm in Vegas. The food was so wonderful, delicious, and reasonably priced. The owner provided the most amazing customer service. He really went above and beyond to ensure that everyone had a good experience. Definitely give this place a whirl if you're in the area!
Good place to get ramen.  We got the tonkotsu shoyu, chashu, bibimbap, and Karobuta sausages (×3).  All on point.  The service was great and the place is nice.  Highly recommended.
Very delicious!!! Love Asian food and nice to have a tapas place to sample multiple dishes.

Bailey is awesome. I came in when they had just opened for the day. The experience is wonderful and it was my first time here. I hope the owner will be able to review this review. She's very friendly. I will return with a bigger party. Thank you for being an awesome Ramen bar and hope to see you guys soon!

As a fledgling restaurant, they are understaffed and made some small rookie mistakes when it comes to their menu and marketing (is it Tapas, Fusion, Bistro, etc). But their food! A group of five of us showed up to a mostly empty restaurant. Tentatively tried a few small plates. By the fourth dish we told the owner that we were completely in his hands because everything was excellent. The Beef Tataki, the 10 Hour Braised Pork Belly were standouts. Here is hoping they survive until my next visit to Las Vegas because Moko is well worth multiple revisits!

I had to give this place 5 stars , its just so amazing i loved the food and it was my first time trying this food and i cant explain how good it was!! The Meat Lover deal was so cheap and good because it had everything just for 18 bucks , loved the service also was really good deff will be coming soon and they even have a rewards card 10 time u get a free bowl (: sorry if its a lot but i just loved this place
The food at Moko is delicious and the atmosphere is bright and friendly. I had the miso ramen. The portion was very generous and the broth was delicious. This is my third time here. Highly recommend!

Moko Ramen has been on my go-to list for a month and finally tried last Saturday night with my friend. Their menu simply consists of small plates, rice, and ramen. When it comes to ramen, there are 2 options to choose; pick one of 8 kinds of signature ramen or make your own ramen. 
We had a chance shortly to talk the owner, Ryan, and could hear that Moko Ramen was originally begun as Korean fusion tapas bar. We noticed that there were Korean rice bowl dishes and a line up of ramen toppings using Korean ingredients like dolsot bibimbap, kimchi, bulgogi, and so forth. 
We ordered a dolsot (stone bowl) bibimbap and a Chashu ramen with kimchi and pork bulgogi as toppings. Bibimbap was served with 6 kinds of well seasoned veggies, chopped chashu, egg, miso soup, and gochujang which is Korean chili paste as a sauce. The stone bowl was heated up and was still sizzling when it came to our table. It was absolutely tasty. Plus we found crispy rice on the bottom of the dish when we almost finished the bowl and it was worth extra credit! 
Chashu ramen consists of Tonkotsu broth, thin straight noodle, green onion, shredded chili string, and black garlic oil. The broth was more than enough to our tong happy and Chashu was the best I have ever had. It tasted and smelled like smoky as it was grilled and was absolutely meaty than fatty, but still very soft and tender.
We will come back soon to try their other signatures.

Frequently in LV and stumbled onto this gem.  Typically when someone says Korean fusion I think of tacos then get depressed because that has been done over and over.  To be fair they also have tacos, which I didn't like (too hard to eat and bulgogi was too sweet), but Ill forgive them because everything else was amazing!  

We started with the eggplant salad which was refreshing and a great way to start the meal, then moved into the heavy guns.  Chicken Pottage and Mackerel Pasta were my favorites, the porridge had great flavor and the poached egg added a lot of creaminess.  We also really enjoyed the Monkfish and Chicken Thigh, very delicately prepared.  I wasn't as blown away with the black bean noodle as other reviewers have noted.  Looking forward to trying the pork belly next time.

Happy eatings!
Was not my cup of tea. If only their noodle bowls had more flavor, i would've enjoyed it. Our waiter was spectacular but the food was not. Wont be returning.
Truly excellent. The eggplant salad, pork belly and the Chilean sea bass are very tasty. The setting is also very neat. The price is exceptionally reasonable.  I highly recommend this one.

Definitely not the best ramen place like the other reviews say.. it's okay ramen. Definitely more expansive than  other places, and they give you a lot less. The signatures are about $9.. and are very basic! Not any extras, like egg, or veggies. Service is mediocre, we didn't get our appetizer. We had already about finished our ramen, when I told them we would like it off our check... appetizers should come before meal.  Nice service, but we won't come come back! Jinya or Monta Ramen are always the go to!
I Had the shrimp tempura & the shrimp fried rice. Very good. My husband also had the green tea ice cream. Perfect spot for a date night.

I would not say it's the great place for ramen in town. The service was slow. It took around 40mins for a bowl of ramen. There were 4/5 people at the time. For the lunch hour if you are in hurry and try to get the ramen and get out there in 1 hour, it's not the right place. Ramen was OK, the pork that comes with ramen was not that soft. the portion size was small for me. Portion size is always people's choice. I am just giving 3 star on the basis of service speed, and taste of ramen.

I would say this place is very nice, and the customer service is top notch. They have the best Tapas that I had in long time, the owner Ryan is great. He is very friendly. I would suggest this place to any one who is looking for good tapas and chill and drink beer and wine. I will be returning soon here.

Definite Korean influence, so if you are looking for traditional ramen flavors this may throw you off, however; if you are looking for some tasty ramen flavors you will be pleased with these.  The curry ramen reminded me of some of my favorite katsu curries, so this was a pleasant new way to rediscover an old go to.  They don't skimp on the extras that you can add to the bowl, especially the ramen itself and if they make a mistake (which they do quite a bit), they will comp your item!  They are near Asian Town and away from the strip, both good things as far as I'm concerned.  A nice variety of items to try, so I am looking forward to going back.

My out of town guests and I tried Moko tonight. Wow! Lots of great surprises. Korean and Japanese fused tapas plates. We tried the cucumber salad, the beef gyoza, the fried onion rings, and the eggplant. The starters were half off for happy hour, which runs until 7. And ladies $2 wines HH mon- Thursday and not just house wines. 

The Stars were the eggplant with its delicate crispy shallots, served cold with micro-greens and the light cucumber salad. 

For our shared plates we really could not decide between the 10hr braised pork belly vs the 30 he sous vide pork belly. Sooo we got them both along with the short ribs and beef tacos. The guys loved the two pork dishes. The debate was do you prefer that roasted caramelized flavor or the pure creamy buttery sous vide?

The ladies preferred the well prepared short ribs with sweet Asian pears. Rich, sweet and roasted. Tender and topped with tiny Garlic chips. All the dishes had these adorable skinned cherry or grape tomatoes stuffed with their skin to look like a tiny purse. Great presentation. W

We still had room so we ventured to the all day lunch menu and tried the classic crispy bibimbap and their black bean sauce noodles. Both were creamy and well balanced. We did try the beef tacos and they were fine... It was the three sauces that made these so special. 

We then tried their classic crispy bibimbap and black bean sauce noodles. Both well balanced and executed on point. 

Service was fantastic. 

Believe it or not, there was dessert ( these were small plates after all shared four ways). The date Creme brûlée was outstanding. I could crave that. The red bean mochi is a classic and also delicious but the CB stole the show. 

Thanks to Ryan and his chef. This place is a hidden gem. Get out there and tell your friends that this new place is worth the trip. We will return for sure.

We came here because of the great Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed!  We arrived at about 1:30 and they were serving from the lunch menu.  I had the kimchi fried rice with bacon. It was delicious. My wife had noodles with black bean sauce. Both dishes came out hot, fresh, tasty and excellent.   The service was great.   The owner was very personable.  We will definitely come back here for dinner!
Outstanding. Best Ramen I've had in a long time. Chasu Ramen was excellent. I will for sure be back. Prices are so reasonable. I cant recommend this restaurant enough!
The staff very nice and kind .  the food was excellent. Plan on coming back again with friends and family.
Yummy food! Especially their Ramen soups and tofu bits! Never fails to satisfy our taste buds!! Thanks Ryan!
An alright place if youre looking for a quick meal. Food was good and the service was fine. Very convenient

Exemplary service, five star quality food! The owner, Ryan, takes so much pride in his restaurant, that it shows in every dish and every drink served.  We come once a week, and have yet to be disappointed. A true locals gem !

We had 4 plates. 

The first two (sea bass, tataki) were small portions, but tasty. 

The kimchi fried rice (we were able to order lunch plates as well at dinner) was meh. It wasn't bad, but nothing impressive. Needed more kimchi and bacon. 

The fourth dish was the black bean noodles. It was good, just not my thing. This was a larger dish. 

Overall, the rice and noodle dishes got us full, but the experience was just... ok.

The decor is cool, the location is ok, the service is great.

I won't be back, but you should check it out.

We came here on a visit to Vegas on a recommendation from a pool server at Planet Hollywood. We ubered over from the strip.  Nice small place with lots of great options.  Our server who was also bartending was very friendly and helpful for some of the group that needed extra attention.  I have already recommended this place to some family who visits from LA often to the Vegas area.

Ramen was really good and was a large portion.  We loved it and will stop by again when we visit again from Chicago.

The ramen was good and flavorful. The chicken was tender and the broth was hot. My sister and I also ordered the karaage chicken was really good. It was crunchy and not dry on the inside. 

I had a draft beer also with my food. I really enjoyed the food and the beer. I will be back because the service was on point  and the food. 

I would recommend!
I just keep saying WOW!! What a great find. The delicious food, ambiance, music, decor and the attentive owner, Ryan make this tapas bar the perfect place for a date.

Service was good! Food was decent! Will go back for takoyaki (5 pieces$ for $5), and chasu ramen. 
Thanks for green tea ice cream!

Food was okay, service was slow even though its pretty small inside. Wasn't particularly impressed by anything but that's my opinion, I might have come on an off day since the reviews here are generally pretty good.

I tried Moko Ramen Bar this past Saturday (9/9/17) with a friend for the first time. The location is very small, and it seems like they have an odd reservation system that I wasn't aware of. We were sat at a small table even though booths were available and were told that those were already taken. Over halfway through our experience people came and left quickly in the larger groups, while we waited for everything from service, to our bill. The servers didn't seem to know where things were going, attempting to bring us someone else's order, and subsequently giving  the only other table at the time our order. The thing that bothers me most is the server actually "dropped" the food off on the table, meaning he served it completely and then turned around and gave it to us when the table said it was incorrect. Coming from a food service background, this is a no-no. Once food HITS a table, that is considered that table's, you can't take a basket of bread that you left at a table and give it to a new table (even if it was untouched). So it irked be a bit, but at this point we had waited so long that I let it go. They also forgot one of our items but charged us for it anyway. 

Aside from the service, the food was actually very good. They have a lot of vegetarian and vegan options, which is always very nice. We ordered and shared the BYO spinach ramen with miso broth, veggie dumplings, shrimp tempura, and kimchi (which we never got). Perhaps in a few months I'll try again, but for now I won't be coming back.

I wanted Ramen so badly and didnt want to travel too far. I saw good reviews so I decided to give this place a try. I was by myself and was originally going to do take-out but they were so friendly I decided to stay. I got the chashu. The pork was really good and the noodles were thin and soft. The broth was also really good, it was not watered down like I have had elsewhere and not overwhelming with salt. The only thing is you have to pay for the egg if you want it, it doesnt come with it (which I thought was odd). Service was also great!

This place is a hidden gem in Vegas. The service was quick and the staff was very friendly. I ordered a moko bun and it was delicious. I really liked the Korean twist with the kimchi in the bun. The chashu ramen was amazing especially with the tasty broth! If you want, you have the option of creating your own ramen bowl. I would definitely come back the next time I am visiting Vegas.

I came in for lunch with friends. Immediately, I was impressed with the service and the quality of the food.  Ryan does an excellent job running the place.

We ordered the Chicken Yakisoba, Kimchi Fried Rice, and Bibimbap. The dishes were so good, I kept eating and honestly, I couldn't tell when I was full.

The food was so good, I came back for dinner later that day. And I ate to my stomach's limits.  Still full.  So great. Planning on bringing friends back in the future.

This is our first time here at Moko Ramen and we're NOT disappointed!!! There's more to this restaurant than just ramen. My husband ordered the meat lovers ramen and I had the bulgogi rice bowl. Both  were delicious! We'll definitely be back!!!

Would I eat at this place again?  Definitely!  Had to try 3 of my favorite items to compare it to other places-shoyu ramen, karaage chicken and Katsu don.  All three past the test.  Karaage chicken-good portion and oishi! Shoyu ramen with Japanese style noodles, left a lasting taste on the taste buds and the Katsu don-loved it.  Across from CSN on Charleston!  Nice atmosphere and friendly and welcoming staff!

First off, the server Lamar was absolutely terrible. He served us shrimp tempura and dropped a few. He said he would come back to give us a new order and that didn't come through until the end. We are a very patient family and we came in with my little brother, who was getting hungry. We ordered three ramen bowls, bento box, and a couple of appetizers. The bento box is for my little brother. They served us with some appetizers which were delicious. Although, the wait for the ramen was 40 minutes!! When it came out we were expecting the bento box to come as well. The manager(very cool guy) said there wasn't an order for a bento box. We told the waiter we wanted a bento box and even said he put the order in. By this time, my hungry 1 year old brother is starving! He had nothing to eat. Our server Lamar basically abandoned us and did not come back to refill drinks or ask if anything was needed. The manager brought a bowl of rice for us and offered to make some spam. He was very kind and very professional. He said he would make the bento box and check up on the tempura.  At this point, we told him no on the bento box. He also brought us extra napkins and took the trash off our table. Lamar finally came back and told us our bento box was coming. We confirmed and said we cancelled our order 10 minutes ago. He was arguing with my mom saying the bento box was coming, thankfully the manager came by and he assured it was not coming and he apologized for the service. The manager was great, but this place needs a better, efficient service. Will not come back.

Great vibe here. Love the style. They celebrate their year mark next month. Very clean. Small intimate place. Went for a lunch date w my hubbs. Staff very friendly and helpful with suggestions. We had a crunch roll, sweet potato fries, and honey spicy wings. Great presentation. So many things I wanted to try. Looked at the plates of everyone else there. They said to definitely come back for tapas style dinner!

Excellent service. :) and their bulgogi pasta was super delicious. 

I'll definitely go back, I want to try their hot stone bibimbop.

3 Ramen, 2 appetizers, 1 kimchi rice and 1 bento = $70

* Their food is expensive. More expensive than Sora, Monta, and Jinya. Did I care? Nope. Was it good and worth the price? Absolutely NOT. 

* Ordered a Shoyu Ramen, the broth is so bland. Originally asked for a spicy ramen but they don't have one. So I just ordered the additional garlic chili paste (1 teaspoon = $.50), it still didn't taste right.

* Even the Tonkotsu tastes like dishwater. My son ended up not eating it. The noodles (thick wavy) are not good either. Very cheap ingredients. 

* Kimchi Rice is average but costs about $10. Not really worth it.

... In the end, I can say that this is a much newer place than all Ramen House in the city. That's why the menu is expensive and the ingredients are cheap. No way to do business! 

... The service is so-so! Our server over-counted the utensils on the table, yet didn't serve us platters to eat appetizers in so we ended up having sauce all over our table. 

... I don't recommend and probably end up not coming back!

This place is suuuuper clean, the ramen is great and the staff are very nice/accommodating. Our waiter took the time to explain any items we had questions about and every time my 1 year old dropped his spoon on the floor, he was there in seconds with a clean one and a wonderful smile. 
On top of the amazing service, the soup was also so so good. I had the miso broth with spinach noodles and veggies. The broth was rich and everything tasted just right. I think we're going to make this our go-to ramen joint!

I absolutely love this place and everyone who works here. I had come in here by accident once I realized that there is more up Charleston Blvd. besides my apartment (new Vegas transplant), and this place is amazing! First, outside of food I think ambiance is important. It's small and intimate and the music to accommodate your ramen choice is pretty great. I usually make my ramen because I'm a little picky, but I think next time I go I'll try one of the signatures. The broth is very flavorful, which is a plus! I've been to other ramen places in the city and realized that something was missing, something very important, which folks call "seasoning". 

I brought my co-worker here and fiance (back to back) and they both loved it! As an added bonus, the restrooms are clean. I don't know about you, but I really appreciate a clean restaurant with clean restrooms in addition to great food, service and music. Last thing, it's awesome that it's still small enough that it doesn't get too overcrowded and I can hear who I'm talking to. Overall, this place is five stars.
We went there for Miso Raman/ Kimchi/ garlic edema me/  all so good .small but clean . Service good too .

My boyfriend and I tried this place not to long ago didn't know what to expect but it was amazing.its tapas so you get small serving. But If you go get the wings they are a must. They are so big and juicy seriously fall off the bone! I'm pretty sure just that can fill you up. Lol. Sweet potato fries and onion rings are good. And the desserts were all soo good. It's a small place but it wasn't packed the service was great and good pricing. Oh they also have sushi and happy hour $2 beer I think. Don't quote me on that tho. Lol. Definitely going there again!!
We are loving the change from Korean tapas to ramen with some Korean goods on the side :-) tonight miss ramen and a bulgogi bento side kimchee yesssss

Not the best ramen in vegas. 

I think this is the ramen joint that nickels and dimes you the most. Their pre established bowls start at 8.95 and come with only a few choices of toppings. Extra toppings are available, however they range in the price of 0.50 to 3.95.

I had the shoyu broth, thin noodles, boiled egg, nori, chashu, and garlic chili paste. Total cost for my bowl: 11.50

8.00-10.00 is about the normal price i pay for a bowl of ramen I get, however the ramen i usually get also includes a lot more ingredients. (Mushrooms, green onions, free chili paste, free fresh garlic, bamboo, etc.)

Girlfriend had tonkatsu broth, thick noodles, boiled egg, chashu, garlic chili paste, and nori. Total cost: 11.50

The boiled egg was hard boiled, not the usual soft boil you get at most ramen places. I feel like it was boiled in soy sauce, because all I tasted from the egg was salt. 

We asked for anything spicy to add to our soup, and the server pointed to the garlic chili paste on the menu for $1.00 (very stingy amount given, whereas it is free at other ramen places)
The couple next to us asked for some, and the server offered the paste and chili powder, and did not mention the surcharge. I wonder if we should have just asked for the paste after the fact because it seemed like the other couple werent going to be charged.

Chashu is normally tender and melt in your mouth consistency, however it was tough and overcooked. I dont think the 3.00 charge for the chashu was worth it for that quality. 

We dont plan on coming back to this ramen joint.
Really good food. I had curry with really good broth . with amazing service. Will be coming back soon.

Easily my Favorite Ramen bar in town I frequently go there with my Girlfriend it's one of our favorite places to eat In Las Vegas. The Ramen is Great. My Girlfriend loves the Bulgogi Rice. Overall great food for a great price

Korean Fusion at its finest.

Items sampled:

- Smoked Mackerel Pasta
- House Smoken Yellowtail
- Beef Tacos
- Soy Chicken Wing
- Black Bean Sauce Noodle
- Omiza Creme Brulee

I'm almost allergic to Italian pasta overpowered by tomato and/or cream sauce, and it's always a relief when pasta is served simply with subtleties like salt, olive oil and not much else. As such, Smoked Mackerel Pasta was a joy.

Beef Tacos came out with tenderloin bulgogi in a thin crispy shell, with three aioli sauce including mustard and lime.

Per the onwer's recommendation, we also ordered Soy Chicken Wing - something we usually don't eat but glad we did - it was lightly breaded and lightly sauced yet it maintained crispy texture. Mmmm!

And Black Bean Sauce Noodle with egg white noodle, black bean sauce, pork, onion, carrot, zucchini, green onion and a poached egg. It was our first time ever to try black bean sauce noodle and now we're a big fan! So intricate yet mild flavors.

Finally, Omija Creme Brulee sealed the deal - it was a perfect closing for the 6 course journey.

We're impressed!
Great noodles, great service, great small place. Has a small bar, TVs, and good music. This place earns 5 stars. : )
This place was very very good. The service was great. We came for lunch and had the shrimp fried rice and Bulgogi noodles and it was more than enough foe both of us. Will def. Come back!
Our go to for when we're craving takeout ramen. Recommend the bento box if your hungry.

I found jjajangmyeon!!!!!!1one -insert celebratory victory dance here-

So.. Moko Asian Bistro ended up being one of my foodie wins of 2014.. and we're at the end of the year.  I'm not even sure where to start.. I appreciate the variety you can get in tapas / small plates, I heart Asian fusion, Korean IS my comfort food, and Moko hit all the above.   Instead of going through the lunch/dinner menu I ran through the small plates one and got the salmon with black bean sauce.. this is the jjajang sauce I've been missing in my life.  Jjajangmyeon is also available on the menu but this was a nice execution of jjajang and salmon.  It does not exist in traditional places, it's flippin genius. 

Other people on here mentioned the 30hours braised berkshire pork belly so I ran with it.  It has "kimchi crepe" under it but those who are familiar with Korean food will recognize it as kimchi-jun or kimchi pancake, with this black raspberry marinated salt.. I couldn't tell it was a flavored salt but it worked with the pork belly and that happy fluffy comforting kimchi-jun-ness.  I also went for the eggplant salad, it has micro greens, was crisp, light house dressing.. I can't really feel like.. I can review a salad and taking it seriously, but it's worth mentioning the presentation was really pretty and everything was the way it should be. 

The presentation on everything that came out was impressive, the last time I saw something plated like the pork belly was at a French restaurant I used to frequent in Scottsdale, AZ. There is a happy hour starting at 5, and I decided to skip the alcohol but honestly it was a little difficult.  They do $2 glasses of wine for the ladies Mon - Thur.. it's something to keep in mind.  This place is smaller than I thought it would be, but it wasn't overly crowded and the owner was very attentive, checking on me and constantly refilling my tea, AND encouraging my usage of Korean despite butchering what little of the language I remember. I'm coming back, and will be attempting a girls thing here.

Random note at the end: I'm really disappointed in the pics I took but I did a half ass job in a hurry because I wanted to eat them so check out the pics on Moko's site - mokolasvegas.com .. they're way better.

Look beyond the strip mall and neighborhood, and try Moko.  Its definitely worth it!

Went for lunch.  They have a lunch menu (dinner menu also available) which is geared for quick lunches and bowls.  All of the food was great!  The salad had good flavor. 
Prices were very reasonable, about $10 / dish at lunch.

Want to go back for dinner and try all of the delicious dishes.
Go.  Run!  Go to Moko!

We have been here two times now and I have to say the food is amazing! My favorite dish is the Fiery Noodle. I also tried the crispy tofu and it was so good. Never been a big fan of tofu but this is one I will order again. The beef short rib was so tender and full of flavor and the beef tacos are very yummy. For dessert, the sweet date creme brulee is to die for!  I even bought a gift card for my son's girlfriend's birthday because I am sure she will enjoy it! The owner Ryan is a great host and very personable!

Good food. Love the kimchi and kimchi fried rice. Build your own ramen.
But only one server that's why didn't rate 5 stars(but it's a hole in the wall what you expect)

Attn Ryan your service was not bad just a little slow but it's okay we deal with those things.
I absolutely love this place. Even my 3yo loved it! I had the curry ramen and it was just amazing. The service was excellent too.

Amazing food. Ryan, the owner, watches over every aspect of service and makes superb table side service recommendations.  Two of us shared six plates.  The beef short ribs, 30-hour pork sous vide, black bean noodle soup with PERFECTLY poached egg and beef tacos were amazing. My husband had the sea bass Surf And Turf and said he would have that again when we come back. Get here before this place breaks out and it's a 45 minute wait for a table!

I have been wanting to go here for a long time now. I finally got to go last Saturday and again last night. It was so good that we took my boyfriend's parents there last night. When we had gone on Saturday, we got jja jang myun - excellent! I loved it, I thought it even tasted better than the one in Greenland. After you're done with the noodles, you can put rice in it and make jja jang bab! We had all gotten lunch specials on Saturday. You get to pick one grilled item, one fried item, and a dessert. It comes with a salad and a side of rice. What's cool was that the lunch special ran all day, we ordered these "lunch" specials at like 9:00 pm. Since we were new to the place, we ordered other things here and there - beef tataki, some tomato soup, and a california roll. Oh! and a side of shrimp tempura. Holy shiznits, they were all good haha When we had gone again last night with the boofran's parents, we ordered some of the same things. We also ordered some new things - the tomato cream pasta i believe it's called, udon noodles, and sesame chicken. All good of course. The guy that was our waiter was very kind and attentive to our needs. When we ordered a side of rice, he gave us nice miramoto? spoons and he offered to take our plates and give us new ones - not necessary since we didn't care - we were too busy stuffing our face to care about the sauces mixing on our plates lol The decor inside is really cute too. They have very artsy fartsy painting on the wall. I would definiety come back here (I already did haha). I plan on coming here more often like maybe once a month now
I enjoyed my meal and the service was very excellent.   Ryan was our server and was very professional.   The place is intimate and deserves to be up held a a great experience for great dining.

Small quaint hidden gem that we found thanks to all the Yelp reviews! This was well worth driving 20 minutes out of our way.

My husband and I ordered the Signature Chashu Ramen and added Egg and Hot Chili. The broth was DIVINE - so rich, flavorful and slightly creamy. I have had bad experiences with Ramen broth being bland but they do it perfectly here! It also came with generous portions of Pork Belly and we each got a WHOLE EGG. Back home in DC, our ramen places only serve 1/2 a boiled egg and still charge $15+.

The prices here are a STEAL! The base for our ramen was only $8.95, and just $1.50 to add the egg and hot chili. 

My aunt ordered the Signature Curry Ramen and added Chicken Bulgogi - she really liked it! It was a nice spin on Ramen and definitely had the rich flavors of japanese curry.

The only con was that service was a bit slow and forgetful, but it seemed like there was only 1 server for the whole place and they were pretty busy. He was very friendly but I would not recommend eating here if you are in a rush. The table next to us received the wrong toppings for their order and had to wait over 20 minutes for their food to arrive.

Dropping the tapas in favor of a ramen concept, Woosuk and his great service are adjusting their offerings to appeal to the odd mix of patrons in the area. Came in to a warm welcome when cold winter weather brought me in for a bowl. Menu offers a trio of specialty bowls and the option to DIY, along with some apps, bento boxes, desserts and beer/wine.

CHASHU RAMEN: a wonderful tonkotsu broth with meltingly soft chashu slices and thin noodles! Really enjoyed the broth, had some peppery spices mixed in for a more forward flavor. 
CURRY RAMEN: a dish that is new to me, the curry broth was similar to a gravy version of the Japanese curry I've had elsewhere. Comforting flavor without too much spice, this comes with thick, chewy noodles, bean sprouts, and spinach. I added nori and egg, but they were unnecessary additions that would have paired better with the previous bowl. 

Enjoying the first bowl far more than the latter, the convenient location and great service will see me coming back to make my own bowl with the best aspects of what we tried: tonkotsu broth, thick noodle, perfect egg, and strips of nori. Our chicken karagge app was solid and helped to balance out the meatless curry dish.

If you're the adventurous sort, note that they also offer the only Pako-men in town: ramen with a crispy pork cutlet!

So.... How to begin.... I've been here twice in one day to eat.... And u know what that means?  The food rocked! :-)  I'm picky about who I give my 5 starts to.  I know I am! Can't help it especially since I'm in the food industry. :-)

Lunch was a simpler easier menu that seemed based off of quick and easily to share food.  Duh. Tapas style u know? :-D it had a good range of Korean and Japanese.  The kimchi fried rice,  bi bim bap and yakisoba (made with udon noodles) were YUMMILICIOUS.  :-) I had other dishes but those three were my favorites but everything I had was good.  :-)

Dinner was more "fine dining" style. I had the 30 hour Berkshire pork... melt in your mouth fatty deliciousness. Yum! The crust on the chicken wing was so light and yet so delicious.  They cook the chicken sous vide in curry for an added depth of flavor before tossing in whichever sauce u choose.  OMG. Delicious and so crispy.  :-)  Black bean noodle (jja-jjang-myun) with egg white noodle... totally was not expecting the noodle but the mouth chew was fantastic.  Love love loved it!  

And if u like SPICY food, ask the server about their soon to be added to the menu spicy ramen noodle.  I love heat and it brought it!  So spicy and yet I could not stop eating it! :-) just thinking about it is making me drool. :-P

Overall, I can't wait to come and eat here again... whether lunch or dinner both menus were over the top awesome! :-)
Great place, the food is delicious! Very friendly and nice owner! I highly recommend this restaurant if you like Korean food!

This restaurant really is the total package: amazing food, great service, edgy decor. So glad I discovered this place, as it is now one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. Literally everything I've had there has been delicious. I can't wait to try everything on the menu. :) You must try the curry tomato soup and dolsot bibimbap. You will not be disappointed.
Great customer service and chicken katsu!! I appreciate microwave safe to go boxes like they have

Clean small restaurant by CSN
Service was okay server welcoming us,let us sat down,take the order,give us food and do transaction for pay 
Food was 4 of 5 stars
Mostly, japan ramens are salty but their ramen is not that much of salty. Tastes clean but doesn't tasted like 'Delicious'.
Awesome food and cool place. I came back twice in 2 days. Fairly large portions and comfortting. Definitely would recommend a stop by here

Location/ Service: I really love how this is across the street from CSN. 
We walked in and we were greeted right away and they told us we could sit anywhere we like.
From the interior side this isn't your type Japanese ramen shop instead it was really Americanized. 

Food: You can either build your own ramen or try their recommended ramen. They even offer korean food too but I believe it's only kimchi and bibimbap. 
My friends and I ordered the chasu ramen and two stone pot bibimbap ($10). 

Taste: When I got the bibimbap (korean version of fried rice) I was very surprised to see a miso soup with it. Anyways back to the korean food I was very disappointed in the taste. It was really flavorless and bland. It was by far the worst bibimbap I have ever tasted. 

I don't mind coming here again to try the ramen but I will not be ordering any Korean food there.

Just to add a short comment, I've been there two times, and as you have already seen from other comments, it is located near CSN. 
Not only the ramen, there are other choices too. I had a ramen first visit then I tried Korean style bibibap second visit, and it was just awesome! (I've posted some pictures) 
Servers and the owner were very nice, and you will be able to see football games too.
If you want to have a light and casual east-asian style, I think this place should be one of your choices to go.
Great place. Ryan Has been open about a year and he's got his play down...service, taste, price..you can't go wrong here, I recommend.
This was an amazing experience. Customer service fantastic. The food felt like being back in Okinawa. The katsu curry was on point.

One thing that definitely stands out about this place is the excellent customer service. Ryan is very hands on, always making sure that his patrons are taken cared of. Try out their Bulgogi Pasta and Pork Belly. Will definitely come back for more!
Just simply perfect. My girlfriend and I come here after long hours at school to fulfill our cravings. Great food, great service. A must have

Had the Curry ramen Vegan style with spinach noodles. It was robust with exotic flavors and spices. So delicious and thoroughly satisfying. Marquis the waiter was very kind and knew what to recommend to me. I can't wait to come back and try the Veggie Lover Ramen.

With so many long reviews, I will only add that this is among the most creative and inspired restaurants in any city. The owners and chef are just what you hope for. Please order the white kimchi noodles (not spicy) if you are just visiting LV, or you will miss out on one of the best dishes anywhere ever. Nuff said.

This place was pretty amazing and the service is some of the best service I've had at any restaurant. The owner clearly cares about the experience and making sure that customers enjoy their experience. Everything we had was great. The mix of options and flavors should be enough to make just about anyone happy. Will definitely be coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

I come here all the time now, this place is just so good. I'm a student at CSN and last year when it was under construction I always wanted to try out what they got when  they finally open, and once I came back and saw that they opened, I came by immediately the very first week at school and I must admit, I'm a regular at this place. 

But gosh, it's so good and undeniably delicious. It's such a treat to eat Korean food (it's one of my favourite foods) and man the flavor and love they put in just blows me away. Hell I always used Yelp to find places to eat but this is the first time I've decided to review a location. It's that good.

They recently came out with a lunch menu that features ALOT of good food for $10 and under, I suggest this place for students (like myself) who want a hearty and healthy lunch.  

Ps. They also give 10% off for students with I.D.'s and for faculty too!

this place is bomb.com .... I've had lots of ramen and this place is amazing.... love how you get to order and having pork in ramen is hard to find .... at least in la. wish there was a place like this near my home  great food.... very good prices
Very tasty food somewhat different .That why I enjoy it The waiters are very nice and helpful
It's a ramen spot. Order the ramen. It's great, tasty and fresh ingredients. Big selection. Also got the moko bun. It's like a manapuna but fancy. Shu Mai  is good too. Small but good.

I got really excited when I read about Moko, because they have vegetarian broth and I've been trying to avoid eating meat. However, by the end of our visit, that excitement was entirely gone. 

Moko is a small shop like many of the other ramen places around town. Diners tonight included a party of eight people that had arrived shortly before us, and a party of three that already had their food. A family of four also arrived right after us. "Cool," I thought, "not super busy for a Friday night." Wrong. 

We placed our orders for veggie mandoo and two bowls of ramen (both custom ramens but only with egg and bamboo added, plus crispy tofu for mine, so nothing crazily time-consuming), and then proceeded to wait nearly 45 minutes for our dinner to come out. The party of four received their menus and food before us, even though they had arrived after. They appeared to be regulars because they were familiar with our server, but I wasn't thrilled about being overlooked (not sure if they were intentionally served first or not). 

The ramen was okay but the mandoo and my tofu were unpleasantly oily. The egg was good but oddly was not cut in half, which made eating it a bit awkward. My miso broth was very salty. However, my boyfriend was satisfied with his tonkotsu broth. Honestly nothing exceptional, as their mission statement promises. 

The food was decent, but what bothered me was the lack of customer service. Drinks were never refilled, and there was neither an update on the status of our food nor an apology for the long wait upon its arrival. I understand that a party of eight might have been unexpected, but the customer service should still have been there. If it takes too long or is too difficult for the kitchen to deal with a heavily customizable menu, perhaps management should consider narrowing down the menu to a more efficient selection. Our server also gave off the vibe of wanting to be somewhere else, which was off-putting. 

Unfortunately, despite the positive reviews from other yelpers, I wasn't happy with my experience here.

Vegetarian ramen options. Korean options. Perfectly al dente ramen noodles. 

I think I've found my new ramen obsession. 

I had the curry noodles which were phenomenal. The service was fantastic, and even the decor was cute and on point. I will be definitely be coming back!
Never had any better!  Great service and food is excellent. Bento Box was great. Small place bit accommodated us worth 25 people nicely.
Great service, good location right across the street from CSN, excellent food. Like to eat here in between classes. It's great. Doesn't take too long.

Small but Cozy Restaurant. Stopped in to take take out but we'll definitely stop by for a sit-down dinner. Staff was nice and the prices were decent. Nice mixture of Korean and Japanese Cuisine. Great tasting Ramen

Only been there 2 times but so far I've loved it. I don't have to go very far for ramen. The waitress and owner are very hospitable and easy to talk to. 
Food has been great and I plan on going back
This place is so cute and fresh!!!  I really enjoyed the teriyaki plate!!  The meat is great quality!  The prices are very affordable!!
Food was all good,and the service was excellent... but $5 for lemonade and I ordered 2for kids,refill once...$20 drinks for kids just little too much...!

I wish there were more stars. But, alas, I'm limited to only 5. The food is gourmet quality, the atmosphere is comfortable, and the service is very polite and friendly. 

One thing to remember while you're there is that this is a tapas restaurant. Hence, the portions are smaller then other restaurant portions. But the important thing is the quality. I've been there three times and have tried new things every time. Everything from the Yakisoba, to the Bibimpap to the 30-hour sous vide pork belly has been sublime. 

Ryan, the owner, is so friendly and gracious as a host. I brought my two very small children in to the restaurant and he took time out to play with them and make sure they were happy, as well as the parents. 

If you're reading this review, you should come to this restaurant for truly great food. There's a good chance we'll cross paths there.

Ramen is good, the broth is very delicious and not too fatty.  The noodles can prob be cooked a little longer for more tenderness but that's my personal choice.  A good variety of ramen and you can create your own! The kurobuta sausages are on point! I ordered three orders.  Service was superb.  Would def come back when I'm in town.  Don't forget to check in on Yelp for free ice cream!

Moko's Fiery Noodles have earned as spot as my current go-to/favorite noodle dish. Check out my previous review for more info...but suffice it to say that I keep wanting to come back for these noodles. I felt it only appropriate to give Moko a 5 Star Review for this. They have a spicy kick (4.5/10) to them...certainly not for the average patron...but fans of spicy noodles should give them a shot.

----This review was written in 2015---
Moko has transitioned to a different concept since then. They are now a Ramen Bar that offers a few Korean dishes...and I miss the great dishes that they use to have...simple case of a great restaurant in the wrong location.

First time in - will be back. Pork belly ramen is amazing. Was concerned that it'd be too salty but it wasn't. Seasoned perfectly. Curry ramen was also a good choice for the vegetarian in the group. If you're on the west side, give Moko a try.

Now on my list of go to restaurants every time I visit Las Vegas.  I am not a gambler but visit LV regularly to eat, eat, eat some more, and play some golf.  Very impressed with the menu.  One of those restaurants where you want to try everything on the menu.  Short ribs were buttery and flavorful, kimchee fried rice was great, spicy popcorn chicken was tasty but could have used more sauce, tempura shrimp was a tad too sweet but still very good, Chilean Sea Bass was perfectly cooked and delicious.  I even liked the strawberry nigori sake.  Overall, a great little restaurant where I still need to try quite a few more dishes.

So my boyfriend and i come here all the time and have basically tried everything on the menu. Everything is phnomenal! Ryan our server is fantastic first off, he's super friendly and honestly he's a reason we come back. 
Now the food, can I just say wow. I don't know who he has cooking back there but they're amazing. I especially love the bibimbap in the clay pot! Everybody has to come here, the service is great and so is the food. Plus now they have sushi and I totally suggest the deep fried rolls super good!

This is one of my favorite quick stops for Ramen. Three Fiery Ramen is my fav cuz I love it hot and spicy! The kimi fried rice is good too.  This is a great place to go to weekend the weather is chilly.  But I go when it's warm too.

Came here for lunch on a class break. 

My pork katsu bowl was huge and so delicious, I'm just sad I couldn't have finished it. The flavors were amazing. I felt the pork was a little tough but I'm not used to eating port in general so I look forward to trying the chicken katsu next time. My classmate enjoy her bowl. She had the same thing as me.

The staff was friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was very relaxed which is a nice break away from the campus.

Definitely will be coming back for another round of ramen.

Food is simply amazing! It is not your typical Korean restaurant, or Japanese, it is kind of in between. It has a great interior, awesome owner and great staff. I am in love with their sesame chicken, chicken wings and onion rings. I tried other stuff on the menu and every single one of them was just awesome. Call your order in if you have limited time, because it takes about 20-30 minutes, but it is well worth it. I go there twice a week and have yet to be disappointed.

They put disguised fish topping in "vegetarian" ramen, without listing it on menu. How can we trust anything???! I googled what the spongey star shaped things were (seasoned ramen consumers probably know this, but we did not!) & almost puked.

First ramen experience, Ryan bartender/server is super welcoming.  The tonkstsu is crispy and really well seasoned, the broth is incredibly layered, the nori, corn, egg, spinach!!!   Everything works...   Just gained a loyal customer.  Love it ...   Eat here you will leave happy

Hands down one of the best ramen spots in town, the staffing is awesome and always welcoming, and the food is always consistent. By that I mean if you want good food every time, come here. It's a small comfortable space that has a very relaxed feeling to it.

This place is pretty nice to eat lunch or dinner, especially of you're really into Korean food! The ambiance of the place is cool, I like their interior designs. Food was amazing! To the guy who accommodated me, kudos to you! I think he's the owner but thanks to you, I will be back one of these days now the school starts soon! I would love to try some more of the food here!

This place has good ramon with many good options. They make excellent broth and also provide good appetizers and deserts and also have a cool like bar. The atmosphere is really cool and laid back. The space isn't that big, but it is a nice little place to go to dinner and not have to deal with a bunch of people.

You moko me crazy! No seriously, is this real life? Chef Hong killed it last night! You could really tell that he tasted every morsel and made sure it was exceptional before serving it.

When we dined here, we had the entire restaurant to ourselves! We were warmly welcomed and received world class service by the owner, Woosuk (Ryan). He treated us like we were old friends and he was extremely attentive and gracious. He's definitely a charming and funny character! We joked around and talked most of the night. I have never in my life have such an amazing host at a restaurant before, thank you so much Ryan! 

This style of dining caters to the food fanatic. This is not a place where you just eat, just to eat - this is the type of place where you'll want to savor with your eyes closed and let all of the ingredients dance on your tongue in perfect harmony. There is such a high level of artistry that went into each and every dish that Chef Hong put out. Seriously incredible.

We tried dishes from every section (salad, meat, soup, seafood, noodle) sadly, except for poultry and dessert. Oh how I wish my stomach was bigger! We'll just have to make an event out of those two categories the next time we come then! 

It was a privilege to taste each of these plates:

Bulgogi Beef Tacos $9 - 3 tenderloin bulgogi tacos, pear, date sauce, soy sauce, mustard aioli, lime aioli all in a thin crispy shell - The bulgogi was so freaking tender and buttery! Each little morsel melted on my tongue. I loved the super thin, delicate and crispy shell they were in. I'm a sauce junkie so the 3 dots of sauce were not enough for me! I'll have to make sure to request more of their delicious sauces the next time I come. 

10 hour Braised Berkshire Pork Belly $12 - soy sauce marinated pork belly, crisp sweet potato, silky skinned and sweet cherub tomato, Kimchi crepe, black raspberry marinated sea salt - This pork was exceptionally prepared and all of the components of the dish shined. The pork was extra tender and delicate. It was seasoned expertly! Make sure to take a bite of the pork with a bite of the juicy, smooth skinned cherub tomato - that's the perfect bite! 

Beef Short Rib $14 - braised marinated prime short rib, crispy garlic, luscious gratin, demi-glace - Is this heaven? Explosive flavor! The short rib was so incredibly meaty, rich, buttery, and melt in your mouth good. The crispy garlic chips added incredible pops of texture and surprising flavor. I loved it. The creamy potato gratin was super luscious and addicting - it was the best choice to pair with the short rib. This was one of my top dishes of the night! 

Bean Sauce Noodle $7 - egg white noodle, black bean sauce, pork, onion, carrot, zucchini, green onion
poached egg - Oooh you fancy, jjajangmyun! The noodles were cooked perfect and al dente, the sauce was loaded up on flavor, oh man and the poached egg, you know it, silky luscious egg porn! This is the best gourmet black bean noodles I have ever had. 

Hot Spicy Beef Soup $7 - beef brisket, mung bean sprouts, carrot, onion, green onion, spicy wholesome beef broth - Warmth for the soul. The brisket was crazy tender. The broth was very wholesome and comforting. It reminded me of eating in my best friends grandmother's Korean kitchen.

Eggplant Salad $7 - grilled eggplant, cherub tomato, grilled Shishito pepper, micro green, Moko dressing - This cold dish was very light, delicate, and refreshing! The grilled eggplant was grilled perfectly and tender, but very smooth and buttery when you bit into it. I also loved the delicate micro greens, they added pops of beautiful peppery notes. 

Shrimp Risotto $13 - sake-steamed shrimp, shiitake mushroom, mushroom risotto - Wow!!! What an epic finale to our meal! Chef Hong brought out all of his tricks on this dish. He used every single part of the shrimp and coaxed so much flavor out of the sweet juicy shrimp head. He even surprised us with delicious shrimp eggs on our plate! What a treat! You could really taste the deep flavor of the sweet ocean in the risotto. Also, the risotto was extremely creamy and seasoned with precision. The best part was the shrimp was steamed to perfection! I'm in love.

Incredible food, great conversation, and wonderful company! Moko has our vote! My boyfriend and I enjoyed our evening thoroughly and we couldn't stop talking about them after dinner and the next day (and the next day). We are looking forward to return very soon.

(Fun Fact: I am Moko's 20th review and this also marks my 200th review!)

Excellent service and best quality food. I got the dolsot bimimbap... stone hot pot... best refills on drinks and tasty everything. Please treat yourself to what you deserve, don't hesitate to ask what you need and want because this place delivers quality and service. Thank you

Very respectful place. We accidentally showed up 10 minutes before closing (which I hate doing) without realizing it and they didn't even mention it until I went to go check in on Yelp. Then I apologized for being "those people" and they kept assuring us that it was no bother so we stayed. I got miso and it was delicious! The owner also gave me a hug when we were leaving. It was sweet! I'll be back!

So I have been to Moko before they changed the place into a Ramen house and it was fine then & so today I decided to eat there before my class. The service was absolutely horrible. The only person that was kind and helpful was the owner, but the rest of the waitresses were rude and super slow. It took forever to get my check and the waitresses were not even doing anything. They just stood around and ignored customers. Another lady also had a question about the menu and tried to call them over and they ignored her and went out back without even acknowledging her. They came back and continued to ignore her and were hesitant to approach her which again is super rude. Probably not coming back here again.

Today has been one of the hardest days this month, since I have so much going on in my personal life. I wanted to relieve my stress with a bowl of ramen. 
I ordered the chashu ramen with thick noodles and an egg. When I got the ramen, I had chashu ramen with thin noddles and no egg. I told my Justin (that's what my receipt says)and another server about the problem and they immediately corrected the mistake. The taller server left and the shorter server with glasses sincerely apologized and made sure I was taken care of. He always refilled my drink, watched my napkin flow, and made sure I was doing well. He made my day! The bowl of ramen was perfect and the customer service was great. I'll be back!!
Such a little hidden gem! The food is absolutely gourmet status. My favorite is the bulgogi pasta. And the organic lemonade is so delicious! I would come here every day if I lived near the north
Best ramen in town . Delicious , savory , low sodium and great price.  The staff is kind and caring , great broths. Try it out !!
Absolutely love the broth. Got one of the tonkotsus but should have made my one combo as it didn't come with ramen noodles but more of a rice noodle. Everything else was great

So Moko Ramen Bar is located directly across the street from CSN and it's honestly a pretty cheap way to get some really decent food. After walking in we were greeted and told we could sit anywhere, then once seated we were given our menus and told to mark down what we wanted and our server would be back to give us our meals. I ordered the curry ramen and my friend ordered the tofu. The food was very tasty and a pretty decent sized portion, my only real complaint is that they put way more bean sprouts than actual ramen in the dish which I wasn't the biggest fan of. The tofu my friend got was pretty small though it was just an appetizer. Honestly for the price the food really can't be beat, my friend and I ate for only 15 bucks which is cheaper than if we had both gone to a fast food place.

From 10/31/15

Came here for lunch! I think they were just opening when we got there because we were the only customers around, which was fine with me haha! 

Our server was very friendly, and our food came out right away, this may be on account of us being the only people there at the time. I ordered the Kimchi Fried Rice, it had bacon in it and was delicious.
 
I want to come back in the evening so that I can try their sushi.

I really wanted to like Moko. I like Ramen, and it's hard to screw up. 

While the food was tasty, it was really overpriced. Each ingredient was priced separately. I ended up paying almost $9 for ramen with noodles, corn, and egg (no meat), plus $3 for a cup of green tea brewed from a tea bag. 

The service was fine, but not great. I likely won't return. As it's across the street from the college, I was expecting more student friendly prices.

To all the foodies in vegas out there looking for an intimate and comfortable place to eat and drink look no further. This hole in the wall was one of the best restaurants i have ever eaten at. The atmosphere and setting are minimalistic and very complimenting, no cluttered or gaudy decorations. Its leaves a very clean and relaxing setting which one can focus on and enjoy their food, plus they play kpop if that is your thing. Now onto the food i had the 30 hour pork belly (which literally melted in my mouth) rests on top of fried pork skin that is a savory nirvana unlike any other. The black bean noodles was simply delicious! I do not really like black bean noodles but the flavor profile of the noodles and sauce was really something you can't stop eating. Their gazoya was crunchy and light with a very tasty sauce with some heat. The bulgogi...now that was something else! The complex flavors and textures all on top of a bed of rice that further soaked up the juices and sauce is truly something one can eat and die with no regrets. It was one of the best bulgogi dishes i have ever eaten. The food is beyond belief and the intimate setting and sevice was a most memorable experience which i shall come back for almost every week. The owner (I believe his name is Ryan did serve us and the only few others there) helped me pick out good sake and good food to eat. If you love both korean and japanese food and want some good drinks to go with it, I would recommend this place without a doubt. There are and will be no regrets once you savor this fusion of pleasure and satisfaction unlike any other. I write this in hopes that those who read will take my word and support this small business and keep them thriving for years to come.

from the service to the food to the experience!! Went with a few co-workers for an after work dinner and had a good conversation time!

Our server was very helpful and personable but not pushy or too comfortable. He gave us suggestions and opinions to help us make our plate selections. 

We decided to do it family style to try a few plates..get the 30 hour pork belly!! We all shared and left feeling full and didn't break the bank!! 

Best of all..the experience. The ambiance was very comfortable and relaxing. There was a couple sitting next to us and it felt very perfect for them..a "date night" restaurant. The lights were dim and subtle and the music in the back round was of all genres but of a soothing and loving tune. 

I so suggest giving Moko a try!!

I gave this place a 5 star because of the food. It would have been a 4.5 or possibly a 4 because of the lack of decor and seating. I was told it's a modern decor but it felt a little more industrial to me. Maybe it's the long dark faux wood tiles on the walls and exposed ventilation system. 

Now on to the food. This is tapas bar but also has bento boxes. On tap they have Fat Tire and Stone IPA. They have bottled beers (everything from coors light to Stella to Angry Orchard). There are also cans of soda and a house red and white wines. 

I sampled spicy chicken was really good. It's crunchy and covered in a chili sauce with broccoli. Then I sampled what seemed to be a tempura shrimp roll with cream cheese, it was really good. I think the star of the show was the spicy prawns. Soooooo good!!! Spicy but not set your mouth on fire. In my opinion that was the best shrimp I've ever had. The shrimp was butterflied and lightly breaded in what I believe was a tempura batter then tossed with this delicious sauce. We ordered just the shrimp and white rice. 

The owner Ryan said that his food is a Korean Japanese fusion. Everything I had was very tasty. I would suggest getting the spicy prawns so flavorful and just yummy!!!! If you love heat get the fiery noodle. That is too hot for my pallet.

I don't know if he is an employee or whatever, but this guy who worked today (10/26/17 @ 4pm) in the bar area was arrogant. He wasn't nice at all! He told me loud and clear that I have to wait for 10 minutes because this is "NOT A FAST FOOD"   (ordered to go  bento beef) All I can is, be nice to your new customer and don't be sarcastic. I know that your restaurant is not a fast food .

I went in a little after 3. I was a little worried because I was the only customer there at the time, but it turned out okay. Service was mediocre, not great, but not bad, at the same time, I wasn't expecting a lot. I had the tonkotsu ramen, and to be honest, it was mediocre. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great like I'm used to at centennial. Will I be back? Maybe. If I'm in the area or something. The food didn't really leave me impressed to the point I was wanting more.

I didn't care for for this restaurant.  If you like loud unrecognizable head-banging with sometimes a lot of bass music, this is your place.  For me, it created an uncomfortable atmosphere.  Beer was cold, husband liked food.  The waiter was pleasant.  Not likely to return though.
Food quality up to my standards but salt level is little more. Parking is horrible and service is pretty Ok. Might not come back.

Amazing. Amazing. 

I love love tapas style foods. So this place has been calling my name for ages but I just haven't gotten around to checking it out until recently. 

Very small, cute restaurant. Doesn't have much sitting. We came during Happy Hour which is Mon-thurs 5-7pm. They have $2 house wines for the ladies, Buy 2 Get 1 free soju, half off starters, and I think BOGO on the beers. I got the house wine which was chardonnay and just 1 order of the yogurt soju. 

For foods we ordered: chicken pottage, seared salmon salad, and fiery noodle. Every thing was extremely delicious. The fiery noodles was ON FIRE! I'm telling you, if you can not handle spicy foods stay away. This is a spicy level 10 x 10! Aside from the fact that I had to keep drinking water after every bite, it was sooooooo good though! the seared salmon salad had good flavors. The salmon seemed really fresh. The chicken pottage was last to come and it was a great end to a meal. It had amazing flavors and it looked really pretty when they brought it out. 

The wait for our food was pretty long but it was really worth it. And you can tell Everything was made to order. We came in with just maybe 2 tables occupied and the wait for our food was still pretty long. 

Highly recommended!

This place is great. The service was awesome. and the desert even better.

Make sure to try their new curry ramen. Great for Vegans and vegetarians which can be hard to find in other ramen establishments.

This is one of the best ramen places in town! I love the concept of building your own ramen!
