There's a lot of variety, from ramen to satisfy meat lovers made with a pork flavored broth to ramen made with spinach or tomato based noodles  and a vegetable flavored broth to satisfy vegetarians!  I loved the tonkatsu shoyo broth with thin noodles, egg, corn, and chicken katsu! Yumm which combo should I try next?

My experience at moko tapas was great! My good friend Ryan just opened this place up and I'm so proud of him. He work so hard! Anyway, let's go back to the business about food. Haha 

I'm a food lover... I eat pretty much anything! Well moko's tapas food was amazing delicious. That's why I would definitely go back here and eat again. The only issue with me is... I eat a lot! I just didn't get full on the spot. That's why tapas is not an everyday place for me to eat. But overall love love love the tasty food! Great service too!

I ate here awhile back and was very underwhelmed - service was extremely spotty, chasu was tough, and nothing about the experience/ambiance of the restaurant made me want to go back. I decided not to write a review until I gave it a second chance because a lot of trusted Yelpers were saying a lot of good things about this place. So I did, and it was unfortunately the same result for me, except this time the chasu wasn't as tough, but still not my favorite. 

On our 2nd visit, the cafe next door was having some hip hop open mic night. (Bad) music was blasting through the walls into Moko Ramen Bar and we asked to get moved from the table to the bar area in hopes of dwindling the sound. I guess this was a sign of things to come for our visit. I ordered the pork belly bun and it was tasty, but pricey and was a small portion for just one single piece (almost $5 I think). My husband had the curry ramen and added spam, which had a pretty pricey $3 surcharge for 2 pieces cut in half, but advertised as 4 pieces. I had the chasu ramen again and I never, ever finish ramen portions at any restaurant because they are usually so generous and huge, but that's not really the case here. Broth was rich, noodles were okay, but there's something not fulfilling and not completely composed about this bowl of ramen that I can't quite explain.  I also typically don't look at the surcharge for extras, but I guess the fact that the meal wasn't satisfying makes those extra charges sting more. Their eggs are advertised as a "boiled" egg, not specifying soft or hard. We got them fairly hard boiled on the first time we were here, but I would say the 2nd time was definitely overcooked. The family next to us ordered dessert first. They were out of the free check-in green tea ice cream. I thought the waitress would have offered a different ice cream instead, but she just stated they were our and listed off other desserts. The family ordered something else, then a few minutes later, she came back to state they were out of that too. Another table near us had some confusion with the bottle of wine they ordered and getting their bill. The server was very friendly, but it just seemed like the business was very green. Compared to other established ramen restaurants, Moko seems very amateur. I took my taste buds over to Ramen Tatstu and Ramen Sora since and was just happier with the overall experience. 

My final thoughts as we wrapped up our meal: I'm glad we went back since now I know this place isn't for me.

Moko ramen is a great place to try out some vegan ramen !!!
Totally blew my mind when I was expecting just nothing but veggies .. 
The miso broth just connected everything together and the spinach noodles were great texture as well
Service is very friendly 
Happy hour on draft from 7pm - 9pm

Will come back to try out the more meaty ramen bowls.
So I'll leave my vegan friend at home.

At 5p on a Saturday night there was only one other couple here. No line!! HALLELUJAH! 

We were greeted and got to seat ourselves. It's quite spacious, not super small inside with a decent amount of seating. It's dim and romantic. I liked the atmosphere. It was clean and nicely decorated.

They gave us a menu and two pencils because they have BYO ramen!! How cool!! They do have a few choices that they have already built but we both chose to build our own. We both ended up building the same bowl, lol - the tonkotsu broth (with out the soy sauce), thick noodles, egg, bean sprouts, bamboo shoots, corn, and chashu. We also ordered the Karaage and beef Gyoza to share.

The ramen was sooooo good, I haven't stopped dreaming about it ever since I ate it. The broth wasn't too thick, wasn't too salty. It was P E R F E C T! I loved it. All the toppings that were supposed to be crispy were, the egg was oozy, the chashu was tender, the Noodles soft and chewy, broth was nice and hot and ohhhh so wonderful. 

The Gyoza was so fantastically crispy! Loved that they had beef Gyoza instead of Pork and that the whole Gyoza was crispy! These were yummy!!

The chicken Karaage is why I could not give this place a 5 star rating :( sadly, they weren't meaty at all and they were hard to chew. The skin wasn't crispy, it was too thin and not as tasty as a lot of the Karaage I've tried at other places. But I did really like that they have a sauce to dip the chicken in, made it much easier to eat! It was a delicious sauce. 

The waiters were friendly, attentive and the kitchen was fast. There was no wait on a Saturday! And I have to say, the tonkotsu Ramen is my favorite bowl of ramen in Las Vegas that I've tried so far! I will definitely, definitely be returning!

It's always a great feeling to have the owner come up to your table even with a quick hello and ask how's everything with the food. Besides enjoying my favorite "Ramen", Ryan is one of the genuine restaurant owners I have ever met! Kudos to this young enterpreneur!

I came in looking for good ramen and that's just what I found at Moko. Great service and a great food, I'm constantly looking for good vegetarian ramen (which is incredibly hard to find at times) with something that has good flavor and texture. And they were able to do just that.

Our server was very attentive and patient with explaining the BYOR (build your own ramen) menu. 

Pricing was good, and it wasn't too busy. Over all very happy with this visit.

I was going to wait on my review after a but I really enjoyed the food.  I think it's only downfall is the location.  It's the only reason to be in that area since I'd rather not dine in area that's heavily trafficed by college kids.  The food is a little above them but they do have a cool lunch menu that seems to cater to them.   I started with an order of jjajangmyun, beef tacos and braised short ribs.  The jjajangmyun is very familiar flavor but with a really rich sauce but not salty.  They'll give you extra rice because why let that sauce go to waste?  The tacos are delicious with sauce but made better by the delicious sauces.   The rib was the best part.  Rich beef flavor, not over seasoned and potatoes are awesome.our second round was spicy chicken and 30 hour pork and some tempura (not my choice).  Chicken was awesome.  Lightly spicy witha cooked kimchee flavor and pork was delicious with a light pork flavor.  For those with a dislike for kimchee both dishes is very mild with kimchee flavor.  The tempura was well cooked a light crispy batter. We followed with some light desserts of mango mocho and the omiza creme brule.  I thought the brulee was the better of the two with a slight bacony flavor.  Service was very good and attentive and we were there for about 2.5 hours and did not feel rushed.  Great place. I'll be back.

Great service, great presentation, great flavors. You really can't go wrong here with Moka. My husband ordered the Chashu and I had the build-your-own ramen with thick wavy noodles, chicken+shoyu base, bamboo, bean sprouts, eggies, seaweed and all cold-killing goodness. 

Not only is my sense of smell back, but I'm walking out feeling fantastic.

Tired this place out for the first time and sad to say I'm disappointed. There was no reason for the undeniably slow service as there was 2 waiters and a busser serving 3 small parties and 1 large party. The waiters were nice but you can tell they did not know what they were doing as they were serving out incorrect orders and sent one of our items to a neighboring table. I had the char su ramen with thick noodles and my fiancée had char su ramen with thin noodles. They did not refill our drinks and we had to ask numerous times only to be forgotten again. The menu selection is not extensive and if you cannot tell the difference between thick noodles and thin noodles then you probably should not be working there as my waiter had no idea ! It is not the kitchen's job to check to make sure the food is ok, it is the waiters job. The only good thing there was the takoyaki but the chicken karaage was way over cooked and not tasty at all :/

Yuzu Shio Ramen.
If you're someone who likes a more tart/citrus soup base (I load up my pho broth with lemons) then I think you would really appreciate the Yuzu Shio Ramen. I'm not even a huge fan of Ramen, but I would come back here for this broth alone.
Till this day I'm thinking about that Yuzu Shio Ramen and wondering how I never had that before. You can customize the ramen to however you want, which is great!



Service was amazing, the guy running the place was helpful and tried accommodating everyone even though he was short staffed. It took awhile to get our food but it was understandable as the restaurant filled up quickly and it was only him working the floor. Kudos to him!

Adam and I are exploring the different ramen bars in town searching for the best one. We came to this restaurant as it is close to where I live. This is a place I'd come back to again and again. The menu had so many options but it was definitely a bit pricey. I'm a fan of shoyu and Adam loves tonkatsu. 

I had shoyu with thin noodles, corn, butter, and an egg. 
Adam has tonkatsu with thick noodles, an egg, and extra pork belly. 
Both were packed with flavor and delicious. 
Mine was, of course, not spicy enough. The owner graciously offered me some of his special chili oil and after adding if I devoured the remaining ramen like noodle genocide. However, has I known they had a special of fiery ramen I would have ordered that. That is definitely on my mind for next visit. 

Oh, we also orders the garlic edamame and it's a perfect appetizer. Nice and hot with just enough garlic but not overbearing. 

Service is great, wait staff is attentive and friendly. What is better than the owner making recommendations and seeing him clean tables. That's when you know someone cares about their restaurant. 

In the words is the terminator, "I'll be back".

Great food! Great service & cute small place!    The ramen was super tasty, lots of ramen and vegetables and very good flavor!  We had the chicken tenders as an appetizer and it was delicious!  Small pieces , super crispy and cans crunchy!  I will definitely come back when in the area!

Delicious soup with fun easygoing staff.
 My order took longer than expected, but came out piping hot and correct. I ordered a la carte and my friend ordered one of the pre-designed ramen bowls. Both were very tasty with properly prepared noodles that were fun to slurp and fantastic broth. The katsu pork in my soup was ok, nothing to write home about, but the meat isn't the star anyway. The bill was a little higher than it needed to be for two bowls of soup (about $18 each) but all in all it was an enjoyable experience and I will probably return. The dessert menu looked fantastic but I had absolutely no room for dessert after filling up on noodles and broth. They played fun mellow music, mostly Post Modern Jukebox and instrumental versions of 90s rock.

Located across the Charleston campus, Moko is a contemporary tapas restaurant with a few unique Korean-inspired selections. I thought the concept was intriguing but to be frank, I didn't know what to expect. Kimchee tacos maybe? The cross-culture tapas menu is definitely trending these days so needless to say, I was excited to try it out. As soon as you walk in, there's a bar at the corner, which is nice because I don't recall any bars in the area. If you attend CSN or happen to be around the area and need a quick fixer, this seems like a good location. I mean they have Fat Tire on tap, which is awesome and my favorite :) Because it was a soft opening, I had a chance to chat with the chef, who used to work at a restaurant at the Wynn. Like most tapas menu, it is inspired to feature 'socialize food' that is best suited with wine or a beer. With that being said, let's get to the food!

For the most part, you can find what you would expect from a regular tapas restaurant, with chicken wings or veggie choices, so it's really not that unusual. However, there are a few unique ones such as the Beef Tataki that comes with a homemade Moko sauce, which is seriously addictive. Highly recommend! My favorite, and probably the best example for the Korean-inspired dish, is the Black Bean Noodles, which is called Jjajangmyun. It's pretty simple, just egg, noodles and black bean sauce but it was one of the best I've had. I liked the menu because it had selections that's unique such as the Beef Tataki and others that's more filling like the Black Bean Noodles.

As for price, I thought it was fair considering the quality of the dish. However, if you're really hungry, the bill can stack up, but that's pretty much a given in any tapas restaurant! They are aiming to create a more experiential and enjoyable atmosphere, which I can totally get, just give me a glass of wine! :) It's a great place to swing by after work or to have a drink with someone that is slightly more intimate than usual, especially in its proximity. All in all, I was very impressed by the overall presentation and selections. I'm excited to see how the restaurant evolves as they continue to work on their menu!
Solid ramen joint on the west side of vegas. Tonkatsu broth was creamy and tasty. The fiery ramen actually lived up to its name with flavor and presentation. Chill ambiance. Will come again.

Moko Ramen Bar has been on my mind for months now, since my love suggested that we have a quick bite before our engagement...take me to there please!!

The restaurant was busy with patrons slurping noodles or ordering some of their own to slurp. I thought they would be full of college students since it is across from CSN but there was quite a mixed group of generations when we stopped in for dinner. 

We sat at the bar and was greeted by the owner and his big smile, ready to welcome you.  He showed us few new additions on the menu, specials boards, and ordering sheets. You can go with a pre-planned bowl of ramen, or use the "make your own" section on the ordering sheets...like BYOR...put anything you want and chef's not going to say NO to you. 

We ordered 
-Fried Oysters
-Curry Ramen with fried egg & kurobuta sausage added on
-Dolsot BiBimbop
-Sake Flight

The oysters were very pleasant with crispy outside and juicy inside. They came with a dipping sauce, but the sauce was not necessary since the oysters are flavorful by themselves. Bibimbop was average, but we asked for some chili sauce to crank up the heat...their housemade chili-garlic sauce was very, very good. My favorite was of course the Curry Ramen...rich in curry and very well textured with thick noodle...I added fried egg and Kurobuta sausage, yummy.

The service was pleasant and prompt...I will come back with my little hungry Loves!

-2017 Review #18-

"ramen is life" 
I have a good life Moko has good ramen cold beer and tasty appetizers.

Moko is located right across from the CSN West Charleston campus, next to the tropical smoothie. We popped in on a very rainy evening. The location is very well decorated and clean. However, it is very small. If you are planning for a party of more than four, definitely call and make a reservation. There is plenty of bar seating. We will probably give that a shot next time. 

     They offer an excellent happy hour. Once school goes into session, I have a feeling we will be spending quite a bit of time here. $2 house wines?!? 20%percent off wine bottles!?! Half off small plates?!? Yes please :) They also offer beers in bottles and on tap and sake! 5/5

      The service... The young man who runs the restaurant, I believe he is the owner... Was so sweet and accommodating. He was very knowledgable about the food and beverages. He wasn't bothered when I asked to modify my dish, and made sure everything was executed perfectly:) 5/5

The food... My boyfriend ordered the beef tacos. They were very tiny and cute. Looked like little tea cups. He said they were delicious. We shared the Lu Lu lemon roll. It was absolutely delicious!! The lemon was a perfect touch. We would definitely order it again! I ordered the bibimbap entree. I asked for it to be prepared vegan (no beef, no egg). It was delicious!! It was beautiful!!! Full of colorful veggies and tofu over rice, it was totally perfect!! It came out with a miso vegan soup :) So much food for the value... And it was great food! We would definitely order it again. We ordered the strawberry sake... Perfect dessert. We can't wait to go back!! 5/5

Give this place at least one try!

Pros:
   Delicious Korean Tapas cuisine
   Draft beer, wine, soju and mixed drinks
   Friendly and attentive owner
   Nice decor
   Plenty of parking
   Small and cozy (seating may be a problem on busy nights)

Cons:
   Can get Pricey (especially if you have a big appetite)

The restaurant and service were both exceptional. Just exactly what you'd want/expect from a neighborhood specialty joint. No menu fatigue here (Thank You!): a handful of options in each category plus five or six specials on the board all showcasing a build your own ramen sheet. Welcoming and simple.

Our only disappointment was with the appetizer course. We ordered the chicken karaage and panko breaded oysters. The karaage was lightly breaded and well seasoned but most pieces were over-cooked. They were nearing a deep-fried jerky state on several of the pieces. The more tender ones were very tasty and we'd give this one another try next time. The oysters were another story. While cooked properly, the quality of the mollusks themselves was very poor. They were mealy and tasteless. Neither of the ones we tasted warranted a second bite nor invited trying the third one. A small setback before an exceptional main course.

We each built our own ramen bowl; one with tonkotsu / chashu and one with shoyu / katsu as the base. Both broths were rich, deep, and flavorful and were the perfect canvas for the chosen meats. The braised greens (mustard and spinach, one in each) were well seasoned and added great flavor. The real star, however, was the ramen-style egg. The whites were firm with a little bite but the yolks were juuuuuust starting to gel. Still creamy and luxurious but with enough body not to dissipate quickly into the broth. A rare and decadent surprise! Both soups were outstanding and the bottom of the bowl came way too quickly.

We will definitely be back and I have high confidence this will become a full-blown, five-star review!
Good decent Ramen spot outside of the strip.

Ryan is the best! Brought the family this round and we had the following: 30 hr pork belly, shrimp tempura, chicken wings with soy base, beef tacos, smoked mackerel pasta and shrimp fried rice! My fam loved it and Moko has gained new fans. My daughter loved the rice, shrimp, wings and belly!
One of my favorite ramen places! It's the only place I go to for Ramen ! Super delicious! I would recommend the Curry Ramen

Great tasting Curry Ramen and the homemade kimchi is awesome! Not all ramen places have vegetarian ramen bases and I love the fact they have a few vegetarian options. The young guy who served me was so pleasant! I will come back!

Do not order delivery from this place.
Do not order any rice dish unless you like gelatinous, gooey, disgusting rice.
My beef bulgogi bento box was awful. The order took over an hour to fulfill. And what I received was horrible. The dressing for my salad had spilled all over my fried food. And the rice was an abomination. 
The ramen was mediocre. But at least it wasn't mind boggling.
I have a hard time believing someone could look at that rice and decide it was fine or even remotely okay to serve it to a paying customer.
Get out of here Moko with your nasty rice!

Place was empty for a late lunch on a Saturday. Pretty basic menu layout - you've got your standard ramen selection and a variety of toppings to add. I got the tonkotsu ramen with extra noodles. Ramen was delicious; the ramen was different than what I'm used to, thinner than most but they do have a thicker noodle if you ask. Curry ramen was already really good. We had a party of seven and we ended up getting some mix ups here and there with the toppings but they corrected it, I ended up with extra corn in mine so I'm not complaining. 

They also serve this extra extra spicy korean chili oil if you're up to it - it's more of a challenge than an actual flavor enhancer. The 'only dip it with the tip of your chopstick' spicy.

Asian fusion tapa style, small portions with lots of flavor! 
 Located right across from CSN, Moko's is a tiny yet trendy spot. Packing flavors from Korea to Japan you'll want to try everything from the Sea bass to the honey spicy chicken wings! 

 My friends and I tried almost half of the menu tapas and from the lunch menu. My favorites include: sea bass with spicy Vegis, 30 hr pork belly, surf and turf roll. 

 Ryan was our server and I believe he is the owner as well. He was amazing! Great service, he kept giving us new plates like a high end restaurant would. He also let us try his new tomato bisque soup which isn't on the menu yet! 

 Overall, Moko is awesome! Great food,
Great service I will definitely be back!

My first ramen bar experience, so I have nothing to compare it to.  That being said, it was delicious.  My wife built her own ramen, I had the Chashu Ramen.  I don't know how they make the broth for the Chashu, but I'd buy a gallon jug of it if I could.

This is hands down my favorite Ramen in Las Vegas. You can start by ordering one of it famous and delicious pre set combos, after having g some yummy appetizers of course. Or you can simply build your own Ramen! How can it get better than this? Well, let me you tell you how.

At Momo Ramen, you will have the best quality broth as the owner always makes sure that their broth is crafted with perfection. You can taste the rich flavor and smooth noodles like you never did before! In addition, their boiled egg and corns are very tasty.

They have a small place, so make sure you get there early as the early bird ear first! Also, don't forget to drink that Stella or Blue Moon (my favorite beers) as they offer a great selection of beers and other drinks of course! I hope you enjoy it, and remember: the early bird eats first!

I actually have never ate inside the restaurant but I wanted to commend the staff that works here for always doing a great job when I order for pick up. My director comes into town a few times a year and every time he comes, we call and make a large order for ramen. Every time I've called and spoken to someone, they have always been patient and attentive to make sure our order is right. There are times when I am making orders for 10 or more people so I definitely value how patient they are working with us! The majority of us always order their curry ramen but have different add ons. It is very unique and delicious. It tastes like something I've never had before when it comes to ramen and my director and many of us at work are obsessed with it!  Thanks again for always keeping our tummies full and happy.
So my girlf took me here and buddy,,, get the creamy melon soda and a build your own ramen and tour set for life.
Rather slow service, made up for by the quality of the food. As long as you expect to wait, then I'd recommend it. Just don't show up with hungry kids. :)

I have to say the food was good. But within the hour of running my chipped card, numbers stolen and used at four gas stations!  Called the owner and he was very rude and unprofessional!!  This I know for a fact!!!  Wanna take a chance?

I have to say that I was very unhappy with my experience tonight.

When we walked in, there was a 25 minute wait, which was fine. I gave my name and number and luckily I was called back within 15 minutes.

We waited about 35 to 40 minutes for our food. My ramen was incorrect and I told them. The waiter quickly said that I was given the wrong ramen, delivered the ramen to the other guest and delivered me my ramen, which was good 

but the waiter did not at any time apologize for the mistake. I understand that people make mistakes but the least they can do is say sorry. 

One star for the service and the second star is because the ramen is good and that the other waiter noticed we were waiting for a long time and went to check on our order.
First fushioned Korean tapas worth coming to. I had an orgasmic time eating all these tapas. My next visit in Vegas I'll be back for another orgasm. Come one come all.

This was a great experience. Some yummy warm Ramen on a cool night. Food was great, a bit on the high side (a "dollop" of Kim Chi was almost $3), but will be back. Staff was friendly, place is clean.
Sadly 2 men dined and ditched.
The service is always personal and accommodating. Cheap beers and apps during happy hour. Some of the best Asian fusion food you can find anywhere and the check check don't hurt. Fat tire on draft.

A little overpriced in the a la carte option.  Their pre-selected ramen dishes begin at $8.95 but are very limited, so you end up spending an extra $3-4 to make it a true ramen dish.  Or you can begin a l carte at $6.95 and most definitely will be paying around $15.  You can select the emat, type of ramen noodle, broth, and accompaniments.  I went with the pre-selected breaded chicken with thick noodles and added corn, bean sprouts, egg, and spicy paste.  The broth was excellent, and the noddles were above par.  The breaded chicken didn't really fit well with ramen in my opinion.  The best part was the paste - small in quantity, but packed huge, delicious heat.  

The service was some of the slowest I have ever seen.  They're not attentive at all, though friendly when you do catch their glance.  The restaurant is rather welcoming and hip considering it's just your basic storefront in a shopping center.  Not my favorite ramen bar, a little pricy, but worth a go.  The have Happy Hour 5:00-7:30 with half off beers, so there's that to consider as well.

I came here for a private tasting. There were seven dishes served, each a delightful, and at times, unexpected, twist on some classic apps. 

My three faves were: 
Deep-fried curry chicken wings (if they sold them in a bucket, I would be so happy) 
Beef tacos (made with bulgogi!)
Spicy prawns

The vibe was hip and modern. Very intimate setting, so it was perfect for the party. I definitely want to come back for lunch!

Another great ramen place!  Conveniently located right across from CSN.  Too bad this whole area across CSN didn't exist when I was going to school there.  

There was a good crowd, but plenty of seating.  Very clean, and there's huge TVs along the wall and behind the bar.  

I ordered the signature chaschu.  The size of the bowl was the perfect portion!  Comes with 3 pieces of chaschu, thin noodles, and a very flavorful milky broth.  

Interesting enough, they offer curry ramen.  Basically, just what you'd expect in japanese curry sprinkled with a load of ramen noodles.  

I thought the chaschu pieces were thin and didn't have the "melt in your mouth" tenderness like Monta does.  Nonetheless, it's still good.  

The noodles were thinner than what I'm used to.  Either that, or there was less than I'm used to.

The broth was very rich and had great hints of garlic, which is awesome because I love garlic!  

Also got the moko bun.  Moko bun comes as one, but they will cut it in half for you if you feel like sharing.  Has beef and kimchi in a sweet steamed bun.  

If you check in yelp, you get a free scoop of delicious green tea ice cream!  And yes, it was super delicious!  I would say green tea ice cream tastes like powdered white chocolate.  

Can I check in every time I come here for the free green tea ice cream?  :)

Service was slow and the day we picked was a busy day for them. The waiter seemed overwhelmed with attending to each table. I wished they had at least another waiter to help. Good thing though the food was good!! Because of that I will come back!!

This place stays true to their mission statement. Great service, simple/clean environment, and great food at an affordable price. Staff was great particularly Marquis ( sorry if the spelling is incorrect).  We will definitely come back.

My first attempt at a RAMEN meal.  My husband previously tried on Spring Mountain... but, menus in Chinese and no English speakers to assist in ordering.  We each built our own ramen, ordering to suit our individual tastes.  I made a variation on the chashu ramen (minus the chili oil) and my husband loaded up on veggies and extra thick noodles.  The server was kind, patient and informative for us newbies.  I also had an order of sui mai.  very tasty, albeit small.

I had the green tea ice cream and my husband had the mango cheesecake, which he said was delicious.

We plan to return.  :-)  Hours later... we still both feel full and satisfied.

The restaurant is small but very hip. The service seemed slightly disorganized (they had run out of paper order slips and were trying to rush to staple more, the single server seemed a bit overwhelmed manning the entire restaurant), but service was still good (i.e. attentive/friendly).

In terms of the food, there are pre-set dishes or you can create your own ramen. The food was made fresh and took a little bit of time to prepare, but was tasty. Price was reasonable.

I think the ramen here was better than I have had at some other places in town, though the broth was still not quite as hot or flavorful as I would prefer. 

The restaurant is also Korean-owned/operated, hence the slight Korean flair of the menu.

Overall, a solid ramen establishment.

Awesome. Wife and I have complex dietary..."situations."

Not only did these have a menu that could accommodate us, but they also knew the kitchen good enough to offer better alternatives to make sure we both had a great meal with no probs. 

The only feedback I could think of- my wife is gluten free. Yay. The standard menu doesn't have a gluten free option. We were able make some changes to the bibimbap item so it would work. I think it would be great if you had a gluten free menu item so people would know what to get. And you could serve it with Tamari!! 

Either way- everything was great. 5 well deserved stars!! 

I'll definitely come back next time we're coming through town.

My family and I found this place on yelp, and decided to spend our New Year's Eve here on a whim - couldn't be happier with our decision. Coming from Chicago, I've had plenty of Korean fusion food before, but Moko really stands out in terms of how unique their take on the concept is, and how well they pull it off. The flavor profiles of the dishes are quite varied and work really well - stand outs for me included the sea bass paired with a slaw of mung beans and carrots in spicy sauce, and the braised Korean short ribs paired with potatoes gratin. Really, though, every dish was good - you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. 

Ryan, the owner, was our server, and provided exceptional service - very friendly and attentive while helping us navigate our food allergies, giving recommendations, and even throwing in a complimentary dessert at the end. The food is very fairly priced for the quality - with several rounds of drinks included, the bill came to about $40/person. The atmosphere is elegant but unfussy - perfect for all sorts of occasions. 

Really, I can't recommend this place enough. Sadly, I'm not local to the region, but I will definitely be back if I'm ever back in Vegas.

Love this place. Simple Ramen joint with a very basic menu, but always delicious and great service. Very reasonably priced and a small beautiful atmosphere. Definitely categorize it as a neighborhood gem.

Review is a little more towards 4.5 stars for me~

Items sampled were 30 Hour Sous Vide Berkshire Pork Belly, Black Bean Sauce Noodle, Beef Tataki, Chicken Pottage, and Spicy Chicken Thigh, in that order.

Moko is the newest take on Modern Asian Fusion, though in this case it is a twist on Korean food. I haven't sampled much fusion Korean, but this first foray had some excellent flavors and the execution of each dish was spot on.

My personal favorite was the Pork Belly - it was tender, but the fat from the pork belly was not too powerful like in some variations. While the portion is quite small for a 13 dollar price point, the tastes are top notch. In my How Korean Is It scale (HKII), I'd say it was a 5/10. Bonus points for the little roasted veggies and the underlying mung bean crepe. This could be served at any high-end restaurant, as far as I'm concerned.

The Black Bean Noodle was another excellent tasting dish, though this one was more in line with its roots. I'd say it's like an HKII 8/10. I was slurping up all the sauce afterwards too. This one is a little heartier than some of the meat-only dishes.

Next followed the Beef Tataki which had some very tender and moist slices of high quality meat. This one wasn't particularly memorable to me for some reason, but everything about it tasted great and the presentation was good too. HKII 6/10.

The Chicken Thigh was probably where I had the most to be picky about - Don't get me wrong, it's an excellent piece of chicken thigh, cooked to be moist and tender and the sauce is quite tasty. It just lacked some substance - maybe a breading or if it was served with a tiny bit of starch or veggies even. The sauce puts this at HKII 4/10.

I enjoyed the Chicken Pottage quite a bit - it was the heartiest and most filling dish of the evening and had some very good flavor to it. Even for a porridge, it looked impressive to me visually. I don't remember the last time I had Samgyetang so I can't really judge on How Korean It Is... But my guess would have been like a 6/10. 

I would definitely tell a person going here not to expect traditional Korean food but a modern take on fusion. I'm looking forward to trying out some more of the flavors here as a lot of them were nuanced and complex, compared to your typical Korean dishes.

While I felt my meal was very satisfying to my taste buds, I did feel like I wanted more - now given I was sharing with two other people we could have certainly tried some more but we decided to save it for the next trip. If there was one thing I could suggest for the menu, I'd like some more heartier options (almost like a filler!) Moko is a Tapas bar, and Tapas often means you always have the option of paella and such, so having like a shared bowl of "modern" bibimbap or something might be a fun twist on that idea.

Price adds up here, but not so much more than a typical tapas place with a very high quality. I felt the effort put into each dish, and the plating pictures on the Yelp are not dolled up at all. Big props to the chef for that and I hope the quality remains!
One of the best places to eat in Las Vegas.  Great service, food, and value.  A must if you like Korean food even in the slightest.

Amazing food! Great prices! The owner, Ryan is super friendly and customer oriented.  Everything is authentic and made fresh. It's the perfect little bistro conveniently located just across the street street from the Charleston CSN campus. Everyone should eat here!

Ambiance great, the decor was nice.  There weren't many people in their which i thought was odd but the food was great ... love tapas - had the beef short rib, the spicy chicken thigh, beef tatki, chliean sea bass with veggies & the smoked mackerel pasta ... everything was great ... just a little pricey as we didn't make it for the happy hour prices.  Will definitely go again

I had high hopes for this ramen place especially because it is just down the street from my house and is highly rated by fellow yelpers. 

The food at this place was 5/5. Everything we ordered including all the sauces were delicious. Some of the dishes we ordered were the beef gyoza, seaweed salad, tofu salad, stone bowl, and the curry ramen and they were all superb. 

The service at this place took off two stars. We waited about 40 minutes for our appetizers which we ordered right as we sat down. Another 10 minutes we got the rest of our food. We dug in quickly, asked for spoons for our three ramen but didn't end up getting them until we were almost done with the soup. Our kimchee also came out right at the very end.. :/ Even though service was a little rough, our server was kind, very apologetic and pretty so I cut her some slack :) being a server myself and all.

Looking forward to coming back for the food! Hopefully they'll have service all straightened out by then. Btw don't forget your free green tea ice cream when you check in. So yum.

I frequent Moko during the lunch hours, so my review is focused on this time frame. I have tried about four different noodle plates, and they are all a treat. My personal favorite is the Jajangmyeon, with the fire cracker noodle coming in a close second. They are good enough to cheer me up after a long study session over at CSN, which Moko also includes a discount for students and faculty. If your new to Moko and dont know what to order, Ryan is able to steer you in the right direction. Very friendly service, delicious food with great décor and prices makes Moko a #1 stop. I believe they also have wifi for students to access when studies and food must be crammed together in a short time. If you have not been here yet, your missing out. Details on dinner comming soon.

Slow service. Took 15 minuets to get our lemonade. 
We ordered the spicy ramen, the waiter asked which broth we wanted, and we choose the vegetarian base, yet we found meat chunks in our food. When I asked what it was, he said it was pork. I guess it said it in the menu in a strange name, you think he would mention this since we asked for a vegetarian broth. He didn't offer to remake it without or give a discount. Waste of money!! Rude and unapologetic.
Consistently great ramen. Tastes super fresh and not as salty as other top places. Also I like how the style of the ramen is a combination of Japanese and Korean.
Great people/service.  Very high quality food.  I was expecting better based on the stellar reviews but very enjoyable experience.

I got my food delivered in a group lunch order and maybe it was the delivery service's fault, but the bowl of ramen I got wasn't that impressive.  The broth came in a styrofoam container, the noodles and the chashu in a plastic bowl.  Maybe the delivery service took too long but the broth was no longer very hot.  The noodles were clumped and had a rubbery consistency, even after they were added and soaked in the broth for a while.  The chashu was a little tough, even after I gave them a long bath in the broth.  But I think my main complaint was that the broth seemed kind of bland.  It just really had no flavor to it.  I was hoping maybe the flavoring had drifted to a deeper undersurface layer but no matter how I stirred, it was the same bland broth.

Like I stated before, I didn't have the food at the restaurant and the time it took to have the service deliver it may have significantly degraded the quality of the food.  I'll go again and if my experience is significantly different, I'll edit my review
Food is AMAZING! Staff is super friendly and helpful, prices are great too! I have no complaints at all. I definitely plan to become a regular here !

Service was very nice, the food had some hits and misses.

Came here for dinner one night with a buddy of mine and we ordered a bunch of stuff to share. The restaurant was empty at 6pm, the staff were very nice, seated us right away and took out drink orders. The pork belly $10 was very tasty and seasoned well, the sea bass was overlooked not here fresh and very chewy which is unusual. The short ribs were very good also. I ordered the stone bowl bibimbap $12 and it was not good at all, the ground beef was very greasy and the rice was too soft and didn't have any crunch like it should, the flavor was a bit off too. 

Service was very attentive, prices are rather high for small portions. Floor was not very clean. Parking was easy.
Some of your Phos are great! Waiting time tens to be long sometimes & it's hard to get waiters' attention

This place is understaffed making the service bad. Although for it not being busy I at least expected decent service. On top of the bad service the ramen was over priced and not even that good.  Very sad, I expected a lot from this place considering the decent reviews.

I've been rooting for this place since it opened. Really sweet guy who seemed to trying to make a go of it, accommodating, etc, and the food was great. The menu was limited but what there was on the menu was great. I'd say they'd been open about a month when I first went there, this is my third visit, I was last here about 8-9 months ago.

I ordered shrimp fried rice, the shrimp were so small that it looked as if bugs were imbedded in the rice. I actually have never seen shrimp that small. I ordered a coke, which the server brought to me and poured for me. That was the last time I was to see her for awhile, she never checked back on me.

The place is pretty small so I guess they feel they only need one server for lunch but that's wrong, since I think lunch is probably their busy time. The server would go to other tables, drop things off, and then look down at the floor when she left the table. There was never any time to just catch her eye in passing. I finally stared at the kitchen waiting for her to come out and flagged her down that way.

When I finally was able to get the check, I asked for a box and a cup for my (full) coke. When she came back she brought my boxed food and I reiterated that I needed a cup, that's when she told me they didn't have to go cups.  Did I mention the sign on the front door that says, "we now deliver lunch".  Clearly they don't include drinks.

I was extremely disappointed in this visit to Moku, and even though they are incredibly close, it will be a long time before I go again.

Having a Korean wife, we are used to eating a lot of Ramen.  Let's just say that this is not the typical Ramen we are used to. It was okay, and the dolsot bibimbap was very good.  May have given 4 stars but they charge for refills of lemonade,  with is just okay and costs $3 per glass. Not cool

I was supposed to meet my friends for lunch today and I ended up getting lost. I stumbled upon this place thanks to Yelp.

First impressions coming in, I noticed how clean it looks. Very trendy, I like the modern meets retro feel of the place.  Good choice in music to compliment. 

Ordered the Honey Chicken Teriyaki with a salad on the side.  Definitely love the presentation of the food and it taste good to boot.  $8 well spent!  The owner Ryan was extremely kind and provided excellent service. Definitely recommend! Kinda glad I got lost! Lol

I was really impressed by this place. 
The food had very good presentation and it tasted very delicious. 
This will definitely be my new hang out spot.
The owner and chef were.very nice and attentive. 
This is the kind of place you really want to support.

Modern looking place. There must of been some type of sewer issue as it smelled pretty bad. We decided to stay since we were set on trying out this place. Only 1 person working the bar and tables. Overall was good, but Ramen Tatsu and Sora are better. Ramen broth needed a little more flavor, no soy sauce/spices available at table. I asked for Siracha/spicy sauce and I got chili garlic which is 0.50 extra charge (not very spicy). Asahi and Sapporo $2.99 for happy hour starting at 7p. Ramen doesn't come standard with egg, bamboo shoots, or seaweed... you have to pay for each addition. Egg came whole and fully cooked like a hard boiled egg instead of soft. Pretty much comes with ramen and green onion. Since this place is pretty close to where I live I would maybe come back due to convenience, but cat help but compare to some of the awesome Ramen places available in Spring Mountain area.

Per Philip T review...... this place is outfuckingstanding!!!! Food was awesome had an array of dishes and loved all of them. I can compare this to the high end restaurants on the strip! Yes it's that's good! I usually don't like tapas but this is exceptional. The decor is very nicely done except there are no cushions on the seats or benches that's the only complaint that I have. The service was great as well. Very nice for a date night. Restaurant is pretty small but very nice.

I WAS a HUGE fan of this place. I loved coming here and would bring coworkers or occasionally ate alone. On August 22, I met an old friend for lunch. I recommended Moko and she agreed to try it. We each ordered Ramen and about halfway through our meal, I noticed a fly in my broth. I was shocked and I stopped eating. My friend noticed there was an issue and told me I needed to inform the server of the issue (my friend is in the service industry). I sat quietly as she informed the server of the fly and showed him. The server said "oh sorry, are you done?"  I told him I was done. He asked if we were ready for the check. He dropped off a check without a discount or an apology. He didn't offer to make the food over. He hardly even acknowledged that he served me food with a fly cooked in it. I'm so sad to say I won't be returning. Due to the fact there was no apology or offer to make things right, I felt that this may be something that is acceptable or happens often.

First off, upon walking in, the decor is warm and modern.  Although they are adding the finishing touches.  Bar area looks nice and inviting.  
On to the food...
Sampled quite a few dishes
Chicken pottage
10 hour pork belly
30 hour sous vide Berkshire pork
Braised short rib
Smoked mackerel pasta
Huge prawn risotto 
Cold cucumber soup 
Black bean noodoohs "jajangmyun"
Hamachi/salmon sashimi 
And creme brûlée to top it all off.

All plates were visually appealing and tantalizing to the tastebuds.  Not your typical "Korean" BBQ place.
The cuisine is not a feeble attempt at another Asian fusion joint.  Chef Hong is executing a twist on Korean with a sophisticated palate and playful combinations of flavors.  They are fine tuning the menu as the venue is breaking in but I can see the direction the food is going and it should be a bright and tasty future!

Gun Bae!

One of my career goals is to moonlight as a small business bistro owner. Moko would be my blueprint for success. I love the clean, contemporary interior. The owner was super friendly and welcomed me by name as I walked in (I had a reservation through Yelp). The service was impeccable. 

The menu is simple and the perfect size. Small portion asian fusion tapas - sample different small plates until satisfied. We started off with the 10 hour braised pork belly. The pork belly was flavorful and tender. The black raspberry marinated salt was quite creative, but I loved the piece of crispy sweet potato that topped it off. Other reviews raved about the beef tataki, but the seared sirloin was the only miss for me. I thought the micro greens went quite well with the beef, but the sirloin was too chewy and not at all moist. 

For the noodle dishes, the favorite seems to be the black bean noodle with poached egg. Yeah, get that damn sexy perfectly poached egg yolk. My personal favorite dish of the evening? Get the spicy honey chicken wings. You will not be disappointed. If you've ever had the famous San Tung chicken wings from San Francisco, you will appreciate this version. Perfectly fried with cubes of pickled daikon to cleanse your palette. Our dinner ended with complimentary red bean mochi. 

I think the only factor holding Moko back from filling its tables is the location. If this bistro was located on Spring Mountain, it would be full nightly.  Spread the word and check it out!

I only eat shoyu ramen when I go out to ramen spots and this might be the best shoyu you can get in Las Vegas. The taste was different than your normal shoyu and the price is very cheap compared to other ramen spots here. The portion seemed a little small compared to other vegas ramen places but it was full of flavor. Will definitely be going back.

Nice, intimate lil place. The food was good, the menu isn't too difficult. The service was on point as well. It didn't take very long yup get our order either. Overall its a nice place to grab a quick bite.

Family owned and run. Convenient location.  Small and delightfully intimate. So comfortable, you will feel right at home. Incredible, personalized service. Yum yum yum! Eat everything you can before you're dead :-)

Moko Ramen Bar is the former Moko Asian Bistro that is transitioning to a ramen bar.  I went for lunch/dinner today after seeing a Facebook post from Moko stating they had curry ramen. I am not a ramen aficionado but I like having soup when it's as cold as it's been the last few days.  

I walked in and the owner, WooSuk, greeted me because I've been there a couple of times.  I sat myself at the bar and the server brought me the menu and the sheet where you check the ramen you want and check off any add ons you wish.  She sensed I was a tenderfoot, so she talked me through the procedure and did the checking off for me.

My order was for curry ramen with an extra of homemade chasu.  While waiting for the ramen, I watched Navy pull away in their football bowl game--Anchors Aweigh, my boys, Anchors Aweigh!

In a short time, WooSuk brought me my bowl of ramen.  The noodles were very hot and the curry had a good spiciness.  Mixed in the soup were some bean spouts, spinach, and scallions.  With the soup, I had a diet Coke.  The soup was very filling and quite tasty!  I need to go back and get the pako with my ramen but the curry is excellent!

Delivery is available through a third party not associated with Moko.

This is my second visit to Moko Ramen but it's my first time writing a review for them. I know people from Yelp normally forgetful about good or great service but sometime just focusing on a bad one, I'm guilty as well. 

Good food, quick service, ambiance and friendly at Moko. 

Food
Good portions, tasty, cleaned and nice presentation. I like their bento box here since I got to try so many things. Fried oysters was delicious, crunchy outside and juicy inside but not too watery. 

Quick Service
The way to ordering their foods here. Checking off the paper menu it was fun and no mistakes. You are pretty much in control of what you wanted. Our server also kept checking on us in case we might needed help. 

Ambiance 
Nice seating on the counter area. For me it's perfect for a single person dining. Cute little place make you feel comfortable. 

Friendly
I am a server of course I always looking for good, seamless and awesome service. Food can be good but if service sucks I probably won't be back. 

I truly enjoyed watching our server (he was alone and the time 1:30pm) he took care of at least 15 people during that time and had an ability to flipped tables pretty quickly while still checked up on people, refilled their drinks, said hi to new customers, closed out tables and said goodbye. 
it wasn't easy! All that mentioned with only one busser who cleaned their tables. On top of that the place was packed and people still kept coming in! Two thumbs up on that. 

I really want this place to do well. Come dine at Moko and you will see everyone here truly bring their passion to work. Let's support our local business.

My daughter loves ramen so we had to find a good ramen place and I must say we were not disappointed you can choose your own broth and topping and it really makes a difference when you choose your own fixens. Sooooo Goooood

I love ramen. I love ramen so much that if it didn't have so much calories and sodium, I would eat it everyday. I thought Ramen Sora and Fukumimi had my heart and soul but I was proved wrong when I visited Moko Ramen Bar. 

Excellent service from two ladies. They were courteous and attentive. I thought the atmosphere was unique for a ramen shop. It's trendy and has this urban feel to it. There are two flat screen TVs above the bar, one was playing football and other one was playing CSI? I am not too sure, haha. 

Their ordering system is also unique. Instead of telling your order to the servers, you mark the ramen you want along with any additional toppings you want to add on a paper. This paper looked somewhat confusing but a friendly server was kind enough to guide me through. At the end, I chose their chashu ramen which is a bowl of thin ramen noodles in tonkotsu broth with generous amount of chashu. 

Took a sip...oh dayum. Their tonkotsu broth is one of a kind. Rich, but not heavy. Noodles were cooked perfectly, or at least was cooked to my liking. Chashu? Holy moly. It just melted, ridiculously tender. Some may find that their chashu has a lot of fat...but who cares about fat when you are eating a bowl of heaven? I sure don't care about calories, fat or sodium at this point. YOLO.

Alright let's start with the Ramen, first off I like the many options you can choose from to build your own bowls. I ordered the tonkatsu-shoyu mix which was pretty good, but I felt like it lacked a certain richness to it but it was still good. On the other hand, the service was on point, my drinks were topped off constantly, and their was always someone checking up on us. I was pleased with the overall experience. (Would of got 5 stars but they don't carry togarashi?)

After searching for Ramen restaurants in Vegas, this was one of the first to pop up with good reviews, so our group decided to make the 20 minute drive from the strip, to try it out. It's a smaller location, so our group of 11 took up a large portion of the restaurant. Our waiter brought us our menus pretty quickly after arriving, and took our drink orders and appetizers. I asked for an order of their Edamame. Which were okay, nothing amazing (I wish I had went with the garlic flavored instead) Another person in our group ordered the beef Gyoza which were pretty good. How their menu works, is you can either choose one of their signature ramen or build your own. I went with the Shoyu ramen added corn, bean sprouts and chicken. The broth was super delicious. To me, this is the most vital part of a good bowl of ramen. The noodles were cooked just right, and servings were generous. As for service, it took over 30 minutes to receive our food, which didn't really bother me, however a few people in our group began to grow impatient. Our waiter refilled our waters every so often, but he wouldn't put ice, so we basically drank warm water for the remainder of our meal. A friend ordered their shrimp tempura, which say come in an order of 5, but he received only 4. He brought it up to the waiter, and was told he would receive the other shortly, however our waiter never brought it out to him. He ended up giving him 50% off when it came time to pay our bills. There were a few times when he would forget to bring things out, or took very long to take care of a request, but his service was pretty good other than that. I'll definitely return here the next time I'm in Vegas!

Very small ramen restaurant 
Good ramen good service good price!! I love there Tonkotsu ramen 
We can create own ramen too !! 
2 ramen and 1 drink around $25 for 2pl

Took me a while to figure out what I ordered. I usually get a shoyu ramen. I decided to go with the tonkatsu shoyu broth with thick noodle. It was very flavorful. So so so so good. The chicken karagae and gyoza was good. Not really a fan of the beef in the gyoza use to pork or chicken. But it was okay. Other then that 5 stars for the ramen!

Feeling like Ramen and i was happy they were participate to the vegan month. It was 2 ramen possibilities. Got the curry after recommendation from the server. It was good but not great, alittle to think on curry for my tatste. I will be back to try the other one.

This is not my thing...Ramen, ramen bars, etc..etc...
I do have to mention that the service was great, kick back ambiance with EDM playing as the background noise, and the ginormous bowl portions that were served is amazing!

Since I am trying to get over a bad cold, I caved in to my daughter's request for a "ramen place" in hopes for some "comfort soup".

I thought I'd try the curry ramen and jack it up with the beef bulgogi, spinach, and boiled egg.  We also got the Miso and Fiery Ramen, which we had accompanied with our appetizer selection of the Karaage Chicken, fried oysters, and a Moko bun.  

Wasn't too crazy about my curry ramen...I expected a more brothy kind of soup, but it was more of a thick curry soup.  My daughters spicy-spicy Fiery Ramen was no joke...It left a burning/tingling sensation in my throat for 10 min...and my husband was content with his miso.  I was disappointed in the Karaage Chicken, I expected a bursting with flavor experience from the photos, but it was "good" (c'mon!  I wasn't feelin it) not great...fried oysters, good...Moko bun, delicious!  I also ordered Oolong tea, and expected it to be a "hot" tea.  It came in a can and was poured into an iced glass - ok, I'm good with that!

I'm glad that the rest of my family were content with their choices...But as for me...'twas ok!  I'm willing to maybe give this a try ONE more time!!  If there is a next time, I'll get a bento box ~ can never go wrong with one of those, right???
Great food. I enjoyed my custom ramen. The naruto cakes are amazing. Gotta get the cookies and cream mochi.

I ordered for take out. The gentleman at the restaurant was really helpful for helping me pick his recommendations. I wanted something with noodles so he recommended this spicy noodle dish. I ordered that and fried dumplings. The dish was delicious and the dumplings were fried to perfection. I do want to come back one night to try their other dishes. Also, the food was quickly made!

So they had us write on a piece of paper to put what kind of broth, ingredients we want. Took sooo long for the food to get to our table, my friends got their food but my took a while longer . When my ramen got to me ... it was the wrong order lol and he was slightly chuckling when i said i got the wrong order. He brought out the papers to check and he said my friend got mine and deadass said to switch bowls when my friend was already eating his . not going back

The katsu is definitely the best I've ever had and the broth is rich. Service is nice but they did actually get two of our orders mixed up. They did make up for it though. It's slightly pricey but the experience was overall really good.

I might be getting back on a ramen kick at last, and it's great timing with new places like this one popping up.

Moko Ramen Bar is located on Charleston across from the main campus of College of Southern Navada. You'll find it right next to a Tropical Smoothie Cafe (with one of the more awkward drive-thru setups that I've laid eyes on), and there was plenty of one-hour limit parking in the later afternoon.

They used to serve Asian tapas, but I never visited them back then, so all I had to go on was a couple of promising reports from friends. I went more traditional today with the Chashu Ramen ($8.95). It took perhaps 20+ minutes for my ramen to arrive (with apologies from the server), but I have to admit that the wait was worth it.

Firstly, the tonkotsu broth was rich. Although it's not the most complex or satisfying broth at I've had, I enjoyed it overall. There's perhaps a hint of ginger that's usually not present. Next taste was the thin noodles, which were just chewy enough. The real stand-out is the copious amount of tender chashu, about four pieces in an otherwise modestly sized bowl. They wasn't extremely flavorful, but they were meaty and can be enjoyed in every bite. This should satisfy those who normally would pay a premium for additional chashu.

What some people might miss is the like traditional standard accompaniments as bamboo, kikurage (both of these seemingly aren't even available as add-ons), egg, and nori. I wouldn't say that I particularly missed any of those at the time. Personally, I was satisfied with the green onions and the very thin red chili slivers that were included. For those do who want extras or are customizing their own bowl, there are a range of extra add-ons for $1-$3.95 (proteins at the higher end of costs) in addition to the choice of four broths (tonkotsu, shoyu, miso, tonkotsu-shoyu) and noodles (thick or thin).

I'm wholly unfamiliar with their old incarnation, but what I had at the new Moko Ramen Bar was among the better ramen experiences in town. It's usually a bit far from home for me, but I'll most likely return to try the curry ramen or to customize my own ramen with a miso broth.

This place is legit.   It was pretty quiet on a Saturday night with one other table sat.  The owner Ryan immediately came over and greeted/ sat us.  We started out with 2 stone IPAs while looking over the menu.  The menu was very impressive and not a typical/predictable Asian fusion tapas restaurant ( which I have no problem with either) we ordered the black beans noodles with poached egg, kimchi bacon fried rice and the soy chicken wings.  While waiting for our food, Ryan came over and offered us a tasting of a new menu item, the tomato curry bisque.  This was so  perfect on a cold night, had great flavor and consisted of flavors I would never think to put together.  This tasting set the entire tone of the dinner and we knew everything was going to taste great.  When written on a menu some ingrediants were either unfamiliar to me or just not something I would never think of ordering when eating Asian food,  do yourself a flavor and try things you would never usually bother ordering, it will taste great!   The food was great,  service was great,  presentation was excellent, ambiance was cozy and the soundtrack/ playlist was awesome.  When we got the bill I was expecting to pay a lot more then we did since we had such a delicious and enjoyable dining experience and we didn't even break the bank,  I will be back *even the water tasted good.

A cold rainy day in Vegas just screams for a big bowl of hot soup So we decided to try a Ramen place we're never been to yet. So Moko Ramen it was- As we wallked into this small restaurant  (as most Ramen Bars are) we could tell the waitress was a little overwhelmed as 3 empty tables still had the leftover mess from the previous customers. But we were seated rather quickly & our table was wiped down so moving on.....  We didnt like that all the pics of the Ramen were located high on the back wall that is actually behind most of the customers seating. So I had to get out of my seat just to see the pics. I think most customers are more visual & a pic to the description of the food is rather helpful if located on the menu. Anyways, I decided to build my own Ramen- Miso Broth, Thin Noodles, Bulgogi, Veggie Croquette, Garlic Chips, Pickles, Seaweed, fish cakes, & green onions. He got the Spicy Ramen which the waitress mentioned that he would love because he likes spicy. We ordered Chicken Karaage & Veggie Eggrolls for our Appetizers. Our appetizers came out rather quickly & we liked the Karaage but unfortunately the egg rolls were tiny & not filled much at all. Now, the filling that was in there was tasty but these egg rolls needed more fullness. Wanted to try their Moko Dumplings but there were sold out already - they make only 100 pieces a day and when they're gone, they're gone! Next time. Our soups finally arrive! My Ramen looked delish & after a few pics I couldn't wait to dig in. My hubs Soup on the other hand was to our surprise not a soup at all. There was no broth, just a bowl of thick curvy noodles with alot of  spicy stuff & some cheese. I could tell immediately by his face that he was not happy at all So of course we called our waitress & we asked all our questions & told her he would like to switch his dish out for a Ramen Soup bowl. She said thats fine but suggested that we should add broth to the spicy noodles & see first if he would like it better that way so we agreed. Seeing that we were disappointed with this dish & I was half way done eating already & he was just sitting there I think his broth should've came right out but it took a while. Not cool So finally here's the broth, he added it to the noodles & didn't like it. So we moved onto an actual soup with well ya know SOUP in it. Lol He got a Tonkotsu Broth, thin noodles, Bulgogi, Pickles,Red Pepper Paste, Garlic, Green Onions, Fish Cakes, & Bean Sprouts. Thank goodness he was satisfied with that. While his soup was still being made I decided to order a Moko Bun, I asked the waitress about the time frame it would take & she assured me that his soup & my bun would come out at the same time afterall there was only a few minutes left of his soup to be done & to make the bun. Well his soup comes, he's half way done eating & I'm wondering where my Moko Bun is? I ask the waitress & she says shes sorry but she never ordered it & never added it to my bill. Well thats not the point, if she realized that she didnt put in my order- ask me if I still would like what I ordered rather than just assume that I don't want it anymore, don't add it to my bill & just hope that I don't remember. Again, not cool. But I still wanted it, so it came & it was yummy but not hot or warm. I paid for it separately as I already paid for our entire bill but I think as a courtesy at this point it should've been on the house but whatever. A few times the Hubs had to get up to get us napkins & ask for a menu. When his final soup came he wanted clean utensils, he asked another waitress & she dropped him 2 straws & left. So he had to get up again to ask for utensils. For a small place they may need extra help. All in all I liked my food, the Hubs wasn't impressed & service was a bit lacking & an important tidbit would be to specify that the Spicy Ramen has no broth.
RIDICULOUSLY delicious. The Moko bun is so so good. Ramen also excellent. A definite must!

Ok....Time for the "tough guy" to admit he's "met his match". I am going to have to agree with my friends Phillip T, Stefany V., and the others, and unanimously give it Five Stars!!!

All of you know that if I give 5 stars, you're not going to walk away with out being totally satisfied. This is the real thing.

I started out with the house salad. It was almost a meal in itself. Great collection of mixed greens, with a dressing that should be bottled. Great starter. 

I then ordered the Spicy Bean Salmon. Unreal!!!! Could have stopped there, but why, when we were on a roll. 

My wife ordered the Spicy Black Bean Noodle. We shared it. She said she'll be trying to make this one at home. I throughly enjoyed it. 

To top it off, my wife enjoyed the more than generous portion of Chicken Wings, pictured in one of the reviews below. It was right on par with one of the best Chicken places in Los Angeles, that makes the trip to LA worth the drive!

After wondering in a wasteland of mediocre and second rate eateries, oh to find this Oasis!!!

Here's the amazing part; the tab was actually under $30 for two. 

Ok, you guys trying to impress girls with Gourmet food, on a College Budget; this is your place. The ambiance is very good, and even though it's tapas, they dress it up with linen napkins and good flatware. 

Let's get out there and support this establishment. We sat and talked with Ryan and as Stefany will attest,  will make it his business to see you have one of the most throughly enjoyable meals at an affordable price.
My Pa Ko ramen was okay and the moko bun was alright. My boyfriend ordered the curry ramen and he liked it and said he would order it again. It was just not happening for me.

I don't normally write reviews but this is the restaurant I've visited most im Vegas and it impresses me every time. Ive also been to a couple other ramen places in Vegas and this one outdoes all the others in my opinion. I like everything from the ambiance to the service and of course to the food. I had the curry ramen yesterday and it was extremely tasty. I also like that this place is accommodating to vegetarians who can't have animal broth - not many other ramen places in the city offer that.

Moko Ramen Offers both Japanese and Korean dishes. There was only one chef at the restaurant so they only offered a selected amount of dishes, mostly from the Ramen menu. The other chef probably cooks the Korean cuisine.

You receive a paper to fill out on what you would like to order. You can also create your own ramen. I ordered the thick wavy noodle, Tonkotsu broth, with Nori (Seaweed). The Ramen comes with Beansprout, Naruto (Fish cake type), and Green Onion. The Tonkotsu broth was nice and light; I really enjoyed it.

We ordered Kurobuta Sausage and Takoyaki to share. The Kurobuta Sausage was juicy and tender. The Takoyaki was delicious too; I recommend at least trying Takoyaki once to see if you enjoy it or not.

If you are Vegetarian or Vegan, they have optional chooses for your Ramen or meal.

The place had a nice atmosphere and the staff were helpful.
The ONLY vegetarian ramen restaurant in Las Vegas. I loved their spinach noodles and curry broth. AMust try!

If I could do 4 1/2 stars, I would.  This place is amaze. My bf had the sesame chicken and I had the honey chicken. Both delicious. Our waitress was adorable, attentive, and sincere.  The only reason it went down to 4 (1/2) stars.... is the wait.  I was on my lunch break and hardly had time to eat, as it took us roughly 20 mins to get the food. Fortunately the food was good and didn't completely mind scarfing it down. Outside of that, 5 star food/atmosphere/service.  Definitely coming back

Not less but Mooo' Ko.  Boom!  Ramen hit spot on.      Went with bulgogi chicken on one which was perfectly done.  Good, cool vibe but please turn down the bar TV just a hint - a little too loud.  Can't wait to come back again!

Let me preface by saying that I am not an authority on ramen in any sense of the word. However, last night we indulged in the spicy ramen and kimchi for dinner and were extremely pleased. I was thrilled with the cleanliness of the restaurant as well as the service. The service was absolutely top notch and you can tell the employees enjoy their jobs. We will definitely be returning in the future.
Stumbled upon this gem while trying to find ramen near me in Summerlin. It's small but delicious! The service was so genuine and pleasant. I will definitely make this a regular spot!

I'd like to give more stars but my experience was OK. Food quality was only ok for me as well. 
I came in during lunch and sat at the bar ordered the chashu ramen with seaweed, the base was awesome, nice, and rich! Chashu was thick and they don't skimp here!! Who doesn't LOVE chashu!? (most ramen places in the valley give thinly sliced or 1 1/2 pieces) their's  was just like home, but my ramen was stuck together in one big wad  wah! I wish I could give 4/5 stars my like my fellow Yelpers gave. I could also do with out the employee commentary of how the boss made decisions although it was light to other guests at the bar that is just not professional. I'll have to come back again possibly for dinner and with a bigger crowd to get a better experience.

I cannot explain how amazing this restaurant is! The staff is amazing the owner (Ryan)  is very friendly and welcoming and the chef is a master! The Korean fusion tapas and meals are in no way traditional but absolutely delicious! If you want to go out for some delicious food in a chic atmosphere this is the place to be! Best menu items:

Pork belly, bibbimbap, jjajangmyeon, spicy honey chicken, hot n spicy soup,  and the creme brûlée (probably the best one I've ever had) 

Enjoy some lemon soju and eat some or all of the above choices and then have some coffee and dessert I guarantee it will be a great night!

Owner & staff were excellent. The combination of Korean and Japanese style options is awesome. This time I created my own Ramen bowl with the chicken broth, Chashu, thick noodles, corn & pickled red stuff and of course threw in an egg. The flavors were truly spectacular (that broth!!), and portions were generous. Next time I need to try the Kara Age, miso ramen, bento, and other great looking dishes. Also a good enough selection of beers including Kirin on tap. Thank you, Moko. See you again soon!!

This is one of my favorite lunch spots when I am in Las Vegas.  Although the place is not large the service is good, and so you can get in and out quick if on a work lunch.  The Bibimbap is my favorite as it is wonderfully awesome! Also have had the Chashu ramen which is also delicious.  Bottom line is I highly recommend!
Every Ramen place is different. Its all about the broth. This is a good place to try the different flavors.  Good portion for the price.

Decent place for a quick bowl of ramen.  

They charged me $ for a tablespoon of sriracha which I thought was a little unnecessary.

Dear Moko, you've made a fan out of me! I like to think outside the box with little local gems like these where the menus are seasonal and the favorites change consistently. I called today and ordered two bento boxes of their favorites as well as a pasta/noodle dish of their choice. I was NOT disappointed. Between the prawns, salmon, chicken and bulgogi pasta we were not only well fed at a great price, but we have leftovers to munch. For just under 40 bucks we had a great experience not only with the helpful and kind staff but the great food at reasonable prices...we are definitely going back. Thank you for the wonderful assistance and great food!! 

Sincerely, 
Your Neighbor and Fan

The food and service was amazing. We were greeted right away and always had our drinks filled. The prices were great for the amount of food we got. The happy hour special was definitely a bonus as well. If I could do more stars I would.

Very good and well presented food is served here. Service is excellent too.  However the servings are extremely small and they are relatively expensive. As a result, you get good, but not outstanding, value for your money here.

There's nothing like a bowl of ramen on a chilly day to warm you up. On this occasion, I had the Moko Curry Ramen. As soon as it is set in front of you, the aroma will mesmerize your nose. As soon as you take your first slurp of the noodles, you will feel warmth and a savory mixture of ramen and curry broth. As soon as you finish your ramen, you will want to ask for seconds.  

The only reason I've given this review 4 stars is because I would have liked to have had zucchini and sliced bell pepper slices in the Ramen to give it a more well rounded Curry- Ramen taste. Regardless of my petty demands, this Ramen was amazing! I can't remember when I first came to Moko Ramen but it will surely not be the last. 
Marquis was an attentive and polite server. This Ramen place has a casual but intimate atmosphere. Everything is very fairly priced and I didn't have to spend 40 minutes to an hour to be sat. 2.50$ for Sapporo or Asashi on happy hour. I will definitely return soon but hopefully next time I won't have to be the designated driver.

Ramen was decent and you get to build it from the base. Service was bad. We were the only party in the restaurant when we came. Waiter did not even ask us what to drink and just handed us the menu. I had to flag him down a couple times to ask for water and a couple sodas because he'd forget. Orders were taken and we finished 2-3 glasses of water, or about 45 minutes in order to receive our orders. Appetizers came out at the exact same time as the ramen as well, and they were cold. Could they not have brought those out sooner to give us something to munch on while we wait for our entree? I think there are better selections around. The ramen bar inside Makino had better tasting ramen.

Love, Love, Love this place!!!
Atmosphere is great, decor is nice, music is good, very nice for date night!
Food is Amazing!!!
Started with Mu sake, YAY!!
The 30 hour pork belly is FABULOUS! This is an absolute must!
The short rib is FABULOUS! And again this is an absolute must!
I had the fiery noodles and YES... they are fiery, really fiery, and they were GREAT!!
We also loved the spicy tempura shrimp and the stuffed chicken thigh.
Service is impeccable and food is really, really amazing!! 
Going back Friday!
Great food and super friendly service. I can't wait to try other items on the menu. Plus they have beer on tap! What a little hidden gem. Thanks, Ryan for the recommendations.

Was here a couple days ago, and decided to try it out. The layout of the restaurant was pretty nice, so that caught my attention quickly. When it was time to order the food, it took awhile for them to take my order down. After giving them my order, it took a long while for them to bring out my food. The food was okay, not as flavorful as I would expect. At the end, decided to just pay and leave. Maybe it was just a bad day to go on, but I don't think I'd ever go back.

Experience:  I really like this place.  I have been here about 5 or 6 times and they never disappoint. 

Food: The food is alway delicious. I have been for dinner, snacks with drinks, and now I have attended the prix fix menu they have introduced on Sat night special parties. 
The last dinner party we went to, they had a salad with the tastiest dressing I've had in a long time. The next course was a chicken katsu which was cooked perfectly. Then they had ice cream for desert. Everything was good!

Service: The owner is a very sweet guy that makes you feel at home.  He and his staff are the consummate professionals and go out of their way up give good service. 

Facility: this is a small cozy restaurant that still has a modern atmosphere and decor. There are about 30 seats, including a few at a small bar. 

Overall review:  This will continue to be a regular hangout for me and my friends. 5 star food and service!
I dined with my family yesterday so I decided to try the Chicken Katsu  curry and it was hot and I drank a Diet Coke but I also asked for water and I enjoyed the meal and they have  on the walls

It's a very nice place to go and eat with friends!
Their ramen is pretty good! The service is really good too! The servers will always check up on how the food is and if everything is good  Definitely going to keep coming back!

I was really looking forward to trying this place after seeing all of the other rave reviews and it being closer to my side of town, but it was honestly kind of disappointing. My bf and I came on a Friday night and there were a few empty tables available. It was really confusing as to if we were supposed to seat ourselves or order at the bar since we weren't greeted until about two minutes after walking in.
