After we were seated we once again had to help ourselves with ordering and turn in our slip at the bar since no one was coming around. We weren't presented with waters until about a minute before our food came out and none of the staff was very friendly at all. 

As for the food I enjoyed that they had vegetarian friendly options. I went with the Curry Ramen. I liked the flavor, but the broth was super thick. My bf has the tonkatsu Ramen and he wasn't a super fan. He said the taste was almost store bought. 

I'm not sure I'd come back here again, maybe only for convenience? I'd love to see them improve on the customer service.

I've had lunch here a few times.  I just stopped in (1:30) because I wanted to bring my wife to try their ramen and the hostess turned us away.  She told us they were closed for the next half hour even though the restaurant was fairly crowded.  Poor customer service.

Bulgogi ramen, green tea ramen, spicy popcorn chicken.

Let me start off by saying that this review is based on a lunch visit because it seems that this place is a hit for dinnertime.  The service provided by Ryan is definitely very refreshing because you don't get one on one service like that in too many places anymore. The restaurant is nicely decorated and is rather artsy, "me like". 

Now on to the food.  

The two dishes we tried was Green Tea Ramen and Spicy Popcorn Bento.  My hubs wanted the bulgogi ramen, but there was a miscommunication and that ramen was not ordered.  We also caught them on the tail end where they were closing up for dinner. 

The presentation of the spicy popcorn was great.  Everything that surrounded it complimented the chicken, but the spicy popcorn didn't impress.  I probably did it to myself because popcorn chicken never impresses me because that means tiny chicken with lots of breading....which is what I got.  If it really was served kaarage style as in large pieces of dark chicken, it might just be good. 

Green Tea Ramen...sorry it tasted like packaged ramen.  Me, I'd call it saimin.  I'm not writing this place off because I def want to give it another try.  But on this visit, I say "meh"

My first ramen experience! And I loved it. We started with a Moko bun appetizer (comes with one in an order, so we got two). I am not a kimchi fan but when it's mixed in with other stuff it can be delicious and it was! The dough/bun part was to die for. Then I had the curry ramen, didn't add any meat cuz I wasn't in a meat mood, and it was amazing! I was nervous to try it but I just mixed it all together and dug in. Freaking perfection. My stomach wasn't feeling great (pregnant) and this really settled it down. The egg was cooked to perfection. Bowl had the perfect amount of spice, enough to taste but not enough to cause agonizing heart burn. The bartender was awesome and super friendly. Will be back for sure.
The ramen for its value in Las Vegas. The restaurant is really small with only 5 tables and a bar that seats 10 people. Ordered the pork ramen with egg and pork.

This is a small cute little restaurant across the street from CSN. We arrived on a Saturday night at 7:30 PM and it was completely empty! It's sad to see a good restaurant struggling for clients. So apparently they have two menus - tapas and full course items. I'm kind of against tapas these days, but I felt like I had to try some of their signature dishes. We ordered the seared Yellow Tail Salad. Unfortunately the Yellow tail was not as fresh as I would like it. This dish comes with a small salad. I enjoyed the apple dressing a lot. We also ordered the Sea Bass with spicy vegetable. This dish was just ok. The fish was fresh, but it was nothing extraordinary. My favorite items were the 10 hour Pork Belly and the Beef Tataki. These are for sure a must try. Overall, the restaurant has a nice atmosphere, and some items were very good. However, the problem with most tapas places is that you have to order and order to keep full as the sizes do not do any justice.
Best ramen I have had in Vegas! Definitely have been here two days in a row!!!! Great service! You get greeted every time you come in. I ordered the curry ramen and I love love it!!
WOW! We had an absolutely wonderful experience dining at Moko. Everything we tried was fantastic. Already looking forward to our next visit. Thanks Ryan!

I stop by as I saw some great reviews. Biggest mistake I made this year. Service was horrible and left before the food ever arrive. Not the only one, followed the 3 tables next to me. Only had 1 person working the front and spent over 1 hour there and only saw 2 bowls of ramen served. A few people were waiting for there take out orders and heard one of them ask 4 times is the food ready to get the same reply. Almost ready!!!!!!!!! You have been informed about this place. Good luck to those who try it.

I love this place. Ryan is so personable and cares about the experience of every person that comes in. Their ramen is WONDERFUL. I have postmates deliver it when I'm sick, I take my boyfriend there for date nights, I crave it after work, I bring the kids here. Their seasoned eggs are always just right. There's nothing I've tried here that isn't delicious. 
       It's a little place, so if you have a party over 6 people you'll have to scoot some tables together but you'll be fine. It's not a fast place, any appetizers you order are made fresh so it may take a minute. Everything comes out piping hot and DELICIOUS. 
       Their happy hour is great, I like their selection of beers. And their sampler flight of sake is AWESOME. I'll go there again and again and again.
carry broth was thick,too much thick - and not a broth for sure ,the noodles taste like they industrial and the chicken Katsu was awful -made with dark meat really chewy and gummy and also tasteless

We arrived near the end of happy hour and discovered we were its only customers this evening. We started off with Fat Tire drafts and ordered the spicy chicken appetizer -  yogurt and sake marinated thigh, Kimchi, sweet potato, sweet and spicy sauce along with a cold eggplant salad - grilled eggplant, cherry tomato, grilled shishito pepper, moko dressing.  The eggplant salad was refreshing, but the chicken thigh proved to be the star.  

Our server, Ryan, turned out to be the owner who took special care to explain each ingredient as it was served.  Next we ordered the 30 hour braised Berkshire pork belly - Korean soybean paste marinated pork belly, carrot, cherub tomato, Kimchi crepe, black raspberry marinated salt and the pan fried Chilean sea bass, mung bean sprout, carrot, onion, hot spicy sauce.  The fish was so good I questioned Ryan if it really was Chilean sea bass, he assured me yes.  Both dishes were amazing though Jack Sprat and Ann may have found the pork belly too be too fatty, but I had no problem licking the plate clean.         

We closed out this feast with an omiza (a small Asian fruit mostly used for herbal tea) crème brulee.
I love this place. It is convenient, close to work and above all food is delicious.  The service is excellent.  This a must try!

First time here with excellent service and amazing food! The greeters were super attentive and provided helpful advice on the menu. We had the grilled eggplant salad, mackerel pasta, and black sauce noodles (forgot the name). They were all delicious items. Of note, grilled eggplant salad is cold-was expecting it hot but still good. Just be aware in case you were expecting something different. Will definitely be back

Moko Ramen produces amazing dishes. Not only is their food and menu awesome, they're vegetarian/vegan friendly! :D

You come in and choose your own table, if the place isn't packed. The server greets you upon entering. When you sit down, they bring you menus and pencils to mark what you desire to consume.

I have tried the:
    ·veggie mandu
    ·veggie spring rolls
    ·curry with rice and daikon radish
    ·curry ramen
    ·hot stonebowl bibimbap
    ·Veggie Lover Ramen
    ·mango cheesecake

All are soooooo good. Especially the curry. By the gods, the curry is to live for. I got on a curry kick for a bit so I somewhat scoured the city of Las Vegas for good curry. Moko Ramen has the best I've had so far. If you want amazing Asian food, go here. Trust me

Yes the service might be slow, but 4 of us chatted through the waiting time so it really didn't bother us. If you want to be served right away or have no patience waiting, this is definitely not the place for you. This Korean-Japanese restaurant is the best combo, my friend can have his ramen while I enjoy the reasonably priced bibimbap, what more could you ask for!

Cockroach body part in the food, very dissapointed about our return visit after I had a great first visit and enjoyed their recipes.  Poor sanitation is unacceptable.  SNDH should do a more detailed inspection for pests infestations here.

Some decent ramen. A chill atmosphere. Down to one chef for now with a small menu, so hopefully they can offer more options soon. They still have signage for some items that are unavailable. I enjoyed trying a new, strange soda and my mochi for dessert.
New to Vegas and been searching for good ramen  Definitely found it at Moko Ramen Bar.  Will be back.

First time experiencing Ramen and it was delicious! The food had a wonderful flavor and the staff was very friendly. The place is small and intimate which is nice! The staff was more then helpful with explaining the menu and guiding you to a selection. I will definitely be going back and trying more things! Not to mention the price is very reasonable for a dinner out!

Great ramen location. My absolute favorite. They have fixed the service issue and dinner was delicious.  I had the stone bowl and it was so good, I ate every bit.  I like to mix it all together with the egg yolk and hot sauce and eat it with a spoon.  My wife had the shoyu ramen with tofu and she loved it.  We had the edamame appetizer and it was firm and tasty.
They live up to their mission statement! I have an extraordinary and stimulating dining experience in a contemporary atmosphere at an affordable price!

This has to be the best ramen around town! Seeing that the restaurant had about a 4 and a half stars I was coming in with high expectations. I was slightly let down by the extremely slow and depressing service.

The food definitely deserves 5 stars. Our group ordered a Tofu Salad (the dressing was amazing), seaweed salad, beef gyoza (perfectly cooked and crispy on the outside with a great tasting dipping sauce), and kimchi to share. All great choices for appetizers. For my main meal I ordered the curry ramen and added a boiled egg ($1.00 extra) and corn (.50). This was amazing! I loved that it had spinach and pickled radishes. Such a unique tasting ramen! I fell in love!

Service was a bit heartbreaking. We had to wait over 45 minutes for our appetizers to come out and almost an hour for our food. And when our food came out, we weren't even given spoons to enjoy the amazing broth. When we asked for spoons the waitress kindly said she was "polishing" the spoons. About 7 minutes later comes back with the spoons but by then we were already almost done with our broth. The waitress was very polite and seemed stressed out so we tried to be understanding although we had a movie to make and were a bit pressed on time.

Although it is a small restaurant, there was only one waitress so do not go here if you only have a short time frame. I really do agree with a lot of the reviews and think that this is the best ramen place around town!
Little Japanese fusion tapas, great food.... Sous vive  pork bleed was delicious, mackerel pasta was interesting but I know taste and smell is not for everybody, black bean pasta was a treat

Tried this place last month and it had an interesting take on ramen! I got bulgogi in mine which was awesome and my boyfriend got a ramen with curry broth- also a cool concept. They tasted great overall but our one big complaint/somewhat of a deal breaker is that the broths were way too salty. A solid 3.5 stars but rounded up to 4 because our server was fabulous.

This place only gets 2 stars from me.  This is my third time ordering takeout and its my last.  The food is good but not worth the wait time good.  Every time I place an order they take at least an hour. Today I called in my order at 12pm.  They gave me a heads up and said about an hour.   Fine..thanks for the heads up, but here I am sitting at the bar at 1:30pm still waiting!!  It's the middle of my work day!  I don't have time for this!  One guy next to me ended up leaving because of the wait time for ONE order of soup.   This is 100% my last time here.  Definitely not happy.

The broth for both the chicken ramen and pork ramen were very plain. No flavour and the hot spice was no help. It seemed like it settled down every time I put more. Disappointed as this place has good reviews  but is severely lacking flavour. However the meat was cooked nicely.

Simply put... Must try! Really thoughtful flavors in the dishes and delightful atmosphere. Tapas done right. 

My boyfriend and I were looking for late night tapas close to Red Rock and found this yelp gem. Definitely see why the reviews are so high. 

I wasn't sure if they were open as we drove by because the restaurant was empty. It could be so easy to overlook. Although, having the restaurant to ourselves was nice. The inside is very clean and modern with a romantic/chill variety of music that I appreciated. 

We ordered three dishes: beef tataki, black bean noodles, and the 10 hour pork belly. The dishes were brought out in this order and only when we had completed the one before. This really allowed us to enjoy each one separately.

Without going into too much detail, I have to say that I would not change a thing about each of the three dishes we ordered. The flavors were perfectly paired and really unique. I found myself gushing over the plating as well. The dishes looked as delicious as they tasted. I can't wait to try the rest of the menu when I return with a bigger appetite!

I feel so bad that the location is probably not the easiest to find or stumble upon, but I will definitely be returning and bringing more ppl!

We visited this restaurant for lunch based on a random recommendation and our expectations were totally exceeded. We wanted to save room for a buffet dinner later on, so we stayed away from the lunch combo for the moment  (next time!!)

The restaurant encourages sharing, so we all tried a little of three different dishes: the crispy sesame chicken, the bulgogi noodle, and the original grilled teriyaki chicken. 
1. The teriyaki chicken met expectation - sweet, smoky, and served with white rice. 
2. The bulgogi noodle was full of umami - little bits of beef, onion, and substantial yummy noodles covered in the bulgogi sauce. 
3. The sesame chicken was my favorite - the crunchy panko coating is infused with sesame goodness and the chicken is tender and juicy.

Do yourself a favor and stop by for lunch. The staff will dote on you, your tummy will be so happy, and your wallet won't be emptied in the process.
Had the Pa-ko  (Katsu) Ramen. Broth was clean, not greasy. Katsu was still crunchy despite being in the soup. Noodles were firm. Nice first try for this place. Trying the Bento  next time.

Visiting from Tucson and wanted something off the strip.  Followed  previous Yelp reviews and glad we did.  Food was delicious and just  right amount of spice . We had Beef Short Rib, Beef Goyza (6) Spicy Wings (6)
Clean...friendly staff, and when in Vegas we will return.

For Christmas dinner, making a reservation for 14 different people is difficult. We were able to come here and get some set menus. There were 3 different versions mostly with the same dishes and some with different ones. There was 1 one with 5 dishes and the other 2 had 7 dishes. To be honest, the size of the 7 dishes was too much. 

The 7 dishes were the following and in this order:
Eggplant salad - since I don't like eggplant, I only had a small part of it. Everyone else enjoyed it a lot. 
Chilean sea bass - small piece of sea bass with some spicy veggies underneath. The sea bass was very nicely cooked. Flaky and delicious. The hot sauce mixed with the carrots, onion and sprouts were delicious together. Probably one of my favorite dishes.
Chicken thigh - Chicken thigh wrapped around kimchi, zucchini,  and other veggies. The thigh was so moist and sauce was great too!
Pork belly - the 5 courses had the 10 hour braised pork belly. This was definitely more flavorful and had a nice texture. Definitely chewier. The 7 courses had the 30 hour sous vided belly that was more chewy. The accompaniments were forgettable but both had the same sweet potato. 
Short rib - probably my favorite dish. The short rib was nicely cooked and the potatoes that came with it were so delicious.  Gratin yum. 
 
The other dishes that came with the 7 courses are: 
Seared salmon - salad with basically lightly seared salmon. Very rare salmon, almost sashimi style. 
Chicken porridge - it's not as good as my mom makes it. But it's as good as any of the restaurant ones I've had. 
Beef takaki - a little rare for my tastes. Seared very lightly. The sauce (bean paste aioli) was all over it. A bit too much for my tastes. 

The lady who was vegetarian has jiajiangmen and she said it was delicious.  Smelled good too. 

Dessert was a berry creme brulee. It tasted a bit funny. Personally I've had quite a few creme brulee in my time and my friend makes a better one.  

Overall,  food was good. Service was great. So accommodating for the Chinese parents we have. 

As a suggestion, I would say that for big groups have everyone order the same menu so it makes it easier for the chef and waitresses to remember who got what. Some people in our group got the wrong items. Also because the people who got 7 courses got their items out of order. The seared salmon and beef takaki were last before dessert and it was an awkward to eat my meal like that.

I was led to Moko because of their super high Yelp ratings, but now I realize it was based on their menu from years past. They currently specialize in ramen and it's a far cry from their expansive menu from before.

On that note, my ramen experience there was a 2-3 star experience. The broth was just awful, and I don't know what happened. The husband ordered the same broth but for some reason his tasted so much better.  We could only guess that the corn and bean sprouts significantly watered down the soup in mine, whereas the juice from his meat added so much more flavor to his soup.

Service took forever from start to finish.  We don't know if everyone just happened to all come in at the same time and the lone waiter was just overwhelmed and couldn't handle it all.  We were sitting there with two starving kids and waiting for menus.  Beverages took a long time too and the wait for food was just insane.  The chicken karaage arrived, but we had no utensils.  I had to request extra bowls more than once.  After they did finally drop off our ramen, the waiter came by to check if it was the correct order. So they obviously had issues going on back there in the kitchen.   

I ate the ramen because I was starving and couldn't be bothered to send it back.  I just know I won't bother returning.

Edited to add: This experience did happen in October 2016, so this review is a bit overdue. The owner did reach out to me to find out more details, which I do appreciate.

Why change a good thing? I think I preferred Moko when it still had the tapas concept. We ate dinner here last week. The kaarage chicken was solid. I ended up ordering the stone pot bibimbap. It was satisfying but not great. My guests opted for ramen but were unimpressed. I took a few bites and felt that it lacked depth. It was also on the bland side. I'm curious to try the curry ramen, but in no rush to come back.

It's our first time here at the restaurant and so far they have the friendly service, esp our server idk her name but yeah, I got myself bento box and it's good, my bf got the customized ramen like when you choose what you want and he said it's pretty awesome but they do forgot to put the eggs on his ramen but then that's fine I'm not going to deduct a star because of it coz it was solve anyways and they apologized anyways. Experience so far was good I'll come back to this place !

Love his place! You can build you own o select a prearranged choice.
 They don't have to go cups so suck that soda down!
 Personable, cute decos,  desserts are divine.
Easy parking, too.

Ok service was great but the special ramen I ordered was meh!   Maybe if I would have ordered a more Korean dish I would have been happy since this shop
Is owned by Korean!

The worst. Came on a weekday night and though there were some patrons, it wasn't busy. The service was very inattentive, you had to constantly flag the waitstaff down for water etc. ordered a tonkotsu ramen. Broth was very diluted and didn't have that rich, takes-hours-to-cook pork taste that a good tonkotsu broth should have. And get this. They ran out of spoons. This was 6 something on a weekday night and they ran out of spoons. I had to wait 10 minutes for them to finish washing, all the while the bowl of ramen was just sitting there. Never again, and I frankly don't get how this place has such good reviews.

It's a 2.5 star bowl of ramen.  It's nice that it's configurable, thin noodles were decent, but was really not wild about either the vegetables or the meat.  I have a problem with ice cold bean sprouts.  I also deducted 1-star for the loud house music that played at elevated volume during our entire meal, relentlessly annoying.

I thought Moko was meh. I got the chicken bulgogi. I liked that the chicken was charred, but it had somewhat of a rubbery texture. The dish itself also just didn't have much flavor - just chicken, white rice, green onions and sesame seeds.

My girlfriend got a custom ramen with just noodles (we shared). It was fine.

The portions were on the small side, so I ordered a beef gyoza because I was still hungry. It was really, really greasy. It gave me a stomach ache afterwards. Plus, it was $5 for very little food. That experience definitely solidified Moko as a two star place in my eyes.

ramen. I haven't had ramen since last winter. 
My buddy and I decided to try moko ramen and it didn't not disappoint. The flavor were amazing just would like more variety on meats and options on topping add ons.

"Nope.  No way.  I'm not going to an 'Asian' restaurant recommended by a white dude from the Midwest that isn't on W  Sahara.  Not going to happen" I say, arms crossed.

"Yeah but you won the bet.  I paid for the car so I get to choose.  You can sit in the car if you like.  It's only 108.  I'll crack a window for you" he says triumphantly.

And for once...

Impressive.

A cross between Korean and other Asian cuisines using  western ingredients.  Each dish is very well constructed.  Each with a nod towards Korean flavors.  Each using those flavors to elevate other ingredients.

True standouts after sampling almost the entire menu include:

10 hour braised and the 30 hour sous vide Berkshire pork belly.  The braised belly, with it's perfectly seared finish, tender and juicy, the sous vide belly, meltingly tender, well rendered.  Both pre-marinated in soy for an earthy sweetness.  Both served in natural jus with kimchi crepe.  Crispy shoestring sweet potato adds the perfect textural foil.

The cold smoked yellowtail and salmon, both over apricot wood that imparts a gentle sweetness is impressive.  The first garnished with apple, the second with orange.  A dusting of ground laver and a dressing of a apricot sauce mixed with Korean chili powder for subtle heat that enhances the natural sweetness of the cold smoked fish..

Not to be missed, a perfectly pan roasted monk fish with over a bed of root veg dressed with Korean chili powder,.  A shrimp risotto (sake steamed shrimp, shitake mushroom risotto topped with a crispy deep fried shrimp head.  The black Bean sauce noodles, so seemingly simple but once you mix the egg yolk through the dish, explodes with velvety, fermented goodness.  Finally a smoked mackerel pasta; think mentaiko with  morsels of slightly bitter fish atop pasta mixed with just the right amount of kimchee.  

Excellent service.  Sit at the bar for the best experience.  The only weakness is the wine, sake, soju list.

Strip worthy at off Strip prices.

Fiery, Fiery, Fiery Ramen! Fiery ramen is one of the signature ramen of Moko Ramen and I'm literally addicted to it. Period. Actually I'm really not a fan of spicy food, but when it comes to this ramen, I am happy to risk my tongue for the irresistible flavor. No pain, No Fiery!
The level of hotness of this ramen for true spicy food lovers may be just enjoyable, not painful at all. But I can tell, whether it is a spicy lover or not, the taste of Fiery ramen is absolutely addictive and attractive. Period.

I loved it ! The way that they cooked  Ramen was amazing!!!I was on vacation in Vegas ,so decided to try Vegas Ramen and it worth it. Tiny place has good atmosphere,good and fast service. Workers are very nice,they were explaining us everything that we couldn't understand ( I mean  some Japanese food and drinks lol) The best thing about this place is you can make your own Ramen. For example ,I choose thick noodles ,chicken broth ,boiled eggs +grilled chicken ,ummmm,grilled chicken was so tender and cooked perfect. Who loves Ramen should definitely check this place out . I will be back again and again.
Was kinda upset cause they was closed when they were suppsed to be opened but waited next door for 20 min and they opened. Curry ramen was delicious. Will definetly be going back.

No thanks. The miso ramen broth was definitely not worth it. Might as well go somewhere else. I have been here once before, my husband wanted to come back against my wishes. I will not return. I give 2 stars because the server was being helpful.

Went there for the first time after driving past out while it was still under construction. I didn't entirely know what to expect, but I was very, very pleasantly surprised!

The restaurant us clean, light and modern. Everything seems very well organized and properly laid out. The restaurant is a little small, so at lunch it gets a bit cramped. The staff is incredibly friendly and they're quick and attentive.

Me and my partner had the Benton box and a ramen bowl. Both were not just delicious but were also arranged incredibly well.

I would absolutely recommend this shot to anyone! It's a great spot that servers amazing food! Go for it!!

I like this establishment because it is a locally owned and operated small business. The owner is very personable and attentive. The location is always very clean and the staff very outgoing.

One of the only ramen places that serves a vegetarian or chicken base. I've been here several times and my kids and friends all find something they like on the menu.

I'm a fan of businesses that are attentive to the customers needs and provide great service. 

The constructive feedback I would provide is a better affordable options for kids and not surcharges for healthier substitutions- like brown rice. My very particular eating son loves chicken katsu curry and loves the curry here - priced at 5.95 + 3.95 (chicken) + 2.00 (upcharge brown rice) - I'd rather go to Zen Curry and get the same for 7.95 no upcharges.

Not my type of eatery but the food and service was absolutely amazing.  Each dish ( shrimp rock, three beef combo, black noodles) oozed with flavor and was unique. Even the chicken wings tasted interesting.  I'm by no means a meat specialist, but the one I ate here was one of the best I've ever had.  Wish this place had more stuff for the kids.   Overall A ++++
Wife and I had lunch here on 4-25 although the waitress forgot our drinks the owner made up for it with Great customer servic,. The food was Amazing and we will be back.

First of all: this place is super cute inside, but small. Your menu is a paper ordering sheet that's easy to read, but bad for people who don't eat ramen often and need visuals. I ordered the curry ramen and added nori, an egg, and pork katsu. The egg was cooked perfectly, nice and soft, and the pork katsu was really fresh. It isn't really spicy, so I added some chili oil (just ask!) The broth had a really great consistency. My server Marquis was super attentive and helpful, and I will definitely be returning!

So I read the reviews on here about the food, and boy were they on point absolutely delicious, my favorite dishes were the Chilean sea bass, the chicken thigh and the shrimp risotto, so yummy! we will definetly be coming here again

I tried this place with my sister on a quiet night. I was impressed by the simple and modern interior design. The place looks spacious and clean. The owner, Ryan was our server and was very eager to answer our questions and make recommendations. 

They serve Asian tapas. The items we tried were:

Eggplant Salad: 4/5
Beef Gyoza: 4/5
Beef Short Rib: 4/5
Beef Taco: 3.5/5
Beef Tataki: 4/5
Spicy Honey Chicken Wings: 4.5/5
Seared Yellowtail Salad: 4/5
Seared Salmon Salad: 4/5
Chilean Sea Bass with Spicy Veggies: 4/5
30 Hours Sous Vide Berkshire Pork Belly: 4/5

The meal ended with our server asking my sister, "did your daughter enjoy the meal?" Good thing my sister didn't hear the daughter part.

Decent small Korean restaurant near CSN with a small amount of seating and a simple decor. They have specials during lunch for common Asian foods like tempura, teriyaki and some Chinese items. Looks good enough for the students around the area.

Dinner and drinks wise, items are decent enough. Tried their specialty short ribs and pork belly but I wasn't really amazed. Tasted just good, not great. Drink selections look all right with American and Asian beverages/alcohol and they even have a happy hour to help push those sales. I'd probably go here every now and then if I lived close enough or attended CSN, but sadly not.

Went in early on a Friday evening so it wasn't too busy. The menu is a checklist where you check off your order and hand it to the server. We ordered a side of seaweed salad, karaage, chashu ramen with tonkatsu shoyu broth, and a beef bulgogi bowl. 

The seaweed salad was a typical seaweed salad, nothing new. The karaage was hot and crispy and came with a spicy dipping sauce. The bulgogi bowl came with chunks of bulgogi beef, rice, and tons of green onions. It was a pretty good serving for the price. The meat was a touch on the salty side but decent overall. The best part of dinner was the ramen. The tonkatsu shoyu broth was so rich and flavorful! I was tempted to ask for a bowl of just the broth to go but I controlled myself. The ramen was just right, nice and chewy, and the pieces of chashu were huge. Huge serving size for the price. 

The restaurant is clean and decor is simple. A nice place to get some good food without a long wait.

Beautiful, sophisticated tapas that were delightfully affordable.  The 30 hr pork belly was outstanding as was the recommended sake with a hint a Asian pear.  We were a large group from a long work day and were treated and fed very well.  The owner was helpful, polite and offered to drive us back to our hotel when our cab didn't show. Who does that?  No one. I am Seattle and a bit of a foodie....this place def gets 5 stars.
I really love this place. It's small quiet and the service staff is very good. Broth is very flavorful and tasty.

I'm honestly not a fan of the ramen here. So far I've tried it twice since it's closer than the ones in china town. The first time I got one of their special ramens but can't remember what. For some reason it lacked flavor. It tasted like it needed something...I'm just not sure what. There was an odd flavor I couldn't figure out & it drove me crazy. The 2nd time I got tonkotsu ramen. I didn't know that the tonkotsu ramen only came with broth & a couple of toppings but no actual pork (chashu). I guess you need to order that specific chashu ramen to get that. That confused me but I guess I wasn't looking at the menu correctly. Just make sure to ask what comes in what. Like other ramen places, you can add toppings as well. I feel like the ramen broths are just missing something. Both times they were bland. I'm still giving it 3 stars since customer service is pretty good & it's not terrible. I like giving businesses a chance so I may come again & try something else in the future.

This restaurant isn't exactly close to my house yet I've journeyed here twice in the last week for takeout. The chasu ramen is my current fave although I keep wanting to try the curry ramen everyone raves about. My daughters like the miso ramen, with eggs and thin noodles. The chasu pork has so much flavor, with char marks tasting of the grill. The service is always friendly and efficient. Tonight the place was packed yet I didn't feel rushed in the least. My stamp card is going to fill up fast in this cold winter weather.

My husband & I went here for the first time Sunday night. The atmosphere is nice & relaxing & the decor is modern & clean. 

Every dish we had was exceptional & cooked to perfection. The service was wonderful, very friendly & attentive. I would absolutely recommend checking this place out & can't wait to go back!!

I love this place! Ryan who is the owner of this fine establishment treats you like family, not just a customer. Every time my husband and I come here the service is superb. Even when it gets busy you are not forgotten like some other restaurants in the valley. The food is simply mouthwatering. I have tried mostly everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. The prices are very reasonable for a tapas place of such fine quality. This place has lunch specials that are better priced than most lunch specials in the valley. I have told people I know to come here if they want fine quality food. I would highly recommend this place. Keep up the wonderful work!

Moko is consistently excellent. Ryan the owner is great and ensures both food and service is phenominal and it always is! Their menu is great,  a wonderful happy hour with great asian beer on tap. I love this place and totally recommend it

Today i went there around 3:30 PM as my first time.

Service is fine, but the quality of food is really bad. I ordered curry ramen and the noodle stuck together. For some reason, if a ramen restaurant can't appropriately cook the ramen, I don't feel going back next time. Also, compare with ramen place around Vegas, this is the worst i ever had. I did also order appetizers, funny joke. Really over price too~~~

My brother is always recommending and inviting me to this ramen bar, normally my schedule is so hectic, but today my schedule was free and the best thing to eat was the tonkotsu shoyu ramen!!!! I was able to keep eating the entire bowl without and hesitation. The broth was well flavored and balanced, the noodles were light, crisp, and the perfect fit with the broth. This restaurant truly a hidden gem, if you can make your way down here to eat some awesome ramen, do it!! You'll definitely love the fact that you did!!!

Edit 2016: This is a totally different restaurant now and does not serve anything like I had below.

I had three thoughts running through my head as my wife and I were walking out.

1. Outfuckingstanding!!
2. I am having this, this and this next time.
3. We better come back soon because popularity is inevitable and I am going to dread when I'll have to wait 30+ minutes for a table.  I'll do it though.  

Eating at the bar was great since we were able to chat with Woosuk aka Ryan aka the owner throughout our meal.  He handles everything with Moko except for the cooking.  That's left to Chef Hong who is a goooooodddddaaaamn culinary wizard!!  That guy is a total one man show coming in at 10am daily to prep all their amazing stuff for dinner when doors open at 5pm.    

Just discussing the effort and detail Hong goes into preparing plates like the delectable beef short rib (butchering the beef himself, select bones to cook with to enhance the flavor, 3+ hours of cooking etc) was inspiring.  A well presented dish, the beefy fattiness of the short rib accompanied by crispy garlic, gratin and amazing sauce was heavenly.    Christina Perri's "A Thousand Years" was playing while I savored it all and it seemed very fitting.  

It's not often that an Asian restaurant includes a spoon for their table setting but Ryan is smart enough to know the sauce for not only the short rib but others like their "Black Bean Noodle" will/need/must be scooped up out of the bowl.  It sure looks a lot more elegant than sticking my face into it.  Genius!   

They offer Berkshire pork belly cooked for either 10 or 30(!!!) hours.  Even though the 10 hour belly is tenderer, how could I pass up 20 more hours of cooking for $1 more?  It was like nothing I'd ever had before.  The soybean paste marinade with the kimchi crepe and their homemade black raspberry marinated salt (who does that???) was exceptional. 

The grilled then chilled eggplant salad with micro greens and tomato was refreshing and flavorful.  We also got an order of the fried soy chicken wings which was like modern soul food with the unique breading and honey glaze.  There was absolutely nothing left but bones.  

I entered Moko expecting a decent meal and left having an excellent one.  There's nothing quite like this in Vegas at the moment.  Go go go!!

I have been on a ramen kick lately and fortunately Moko Ramen Bar satisfied it.  The service was excellent.  The young gentleman took great care of us and welcomed us with a smile.  We went on a Saturday afternoon and luckily for us it was not busy.  
Ramen was delicious and the broth was excellent.  The noodles were soft and chewy and the toppings complimented it just perfectly.

I appreciate the amazing service at Moko Ramen Bar.  We will definitely be back.

I honestly cannot give this place enough stars. The food and ambiance are always on point. The owner Ryan is an absolutely lovely person. He always remembers us from our first visit back in 2014 to today. I want this place to succeed more than anything!

We went for a date night recently and both got the Chashu ramen. There was a healthy amount of meat and the broth had so much flavor. It was really perfect for a cool fall night. We also split the shumai and that was yummy too.

Will be a forever customer of this place. We still miss the original restaurant style but the ramen is still really tasty.

So went here for lunch with my coworker because it had good ratings. Upon walking in I thought it was super classy looking inside, upset clean and bright. The server was this Asian guy and he was very clean cut, friendly and professional. 

We got menus and drinks quickly. The place was pretty empty so our food also came fast. I got the Thai chicken with salad. It came with Thai seasoned chicken, white rice, broccoli, small side salad, and a small cucumber salad as well. At first glance to me if seemed like a lot of food. I didn't like that the salad and veggies were doused in some house dressing. Pretty much made the healthy stuff unhealthy without you even trying. Why didn't they put it on the side?? No idea. 

The quality of the Thai chicken was not up to par. Felt chewy and super low quality. I wouldn't go here again simply because of that. It's too bad because otherwise I thought the place was nice, cute and the staff was friendly.
Yelp told the truth, this ramen is amazing. The tonkatsu broth is maybe the best I've ever had, perfectly balanced. Really nice staff and cozy atmosphere too.

I've lived in Las Vegas for 7 years & every Korean restaurant has been a huge disappointment, all except this little gem.

First, I wanna say that My parents were Korean/Chinese restaurant owners for over 20+ years & have won year over year local & nationally recognized awards from the local newspaper to Zagat.

Homemade Korean food has always been my mom's greatest attribute to my upbringing, she was born old school on a farm in S. Korea - she knows how to cook the real good old fashion Korean stuff.

First time at this cute inviting restaurant - across from CSN college.  I tried the Bibimbap & was surprised how tasty it was & closely resembled my mother's cooking back home.

This will be my first go to Korean restaurant in 7 yrs, at least for the Bibimbap (don't know about other dishes, but I'll try latter on)

Thank you Moko!

Well well well...what do we have hear?  ...a new and fresh tapas joint near the office??  This place was shared to me by my undercover freelance foodie co-worker and I quickly jumped on it with my patnah about two weeks ago.  Unfortunately for us, the place was closed for staff training.  Yet, that all changed today, as I slid through for a quick lunch session.
Moko is fairly tight and seats less than 35 total, which can be intimate and what you are looking for.  I am always looking to eat in peace and quiet and want to hear myself chewing (sorry STK).  Upon entry, you will immediately notice the new and pristine decor, wall back splash tiling, laminate flooring and calming lounge music.  Luckily the position of entryway faces south so may be okay during the later summer hours without getting toasted alive by the radiant sun rays.

I was promptly greeted by the lone staff member who was polite and personable to an extent, then again I was the only person in when I popped up.  An acquaintance of him showed a few minutes later for a meal, thank goodness.  I really didn't want to feel like I was browsing in a liquor store with a bottle of Old E and someone creeps up on with their dusting/espionage role uttering, "hurry up and buy!!!"  Okay, okay, don't lynch me for my poor scenario choice referencing "Boyz n the Hood," I ain't O-Dogg but oh boy was cool in my book.  (J/K to my Kornz brethren)  

It was a hot day and I was hoping for some ice barley water, but I was sadly mistaken, or perhaps generalizing again.  However, after obviously and overtly Yelping, I think I got the attention of the waiter/server/owner to get me some unsweetened ice tea on the house.  Word to the wise, totally play out your Yelping efforts, it definitely gets the staff to come correct.  

I was provided the lunch menu that was extremely limited.  I'm talking 6 items tops and all starches.  I did peep the dinner menu which was still pretty limited but offered more signature dishes that everybody seems to be raving about.  10 & 30 hour pork belly?  Bulgogi meatball, sea bass and more??  Although I was hoping to find a cold noodle dish to combat the Las Vegas heat, no such dish was offered so resorted to the Jajangmyun instead.   When served, it was hot and the noodle texture was just right, but may be overpriced at $7 bones for glorified comfort food.  You can barely taste the ingredients that is sort of drowned by the black bean sauce and the pork tasted precooked/frozen (wish that was aged a few years), pretty greasy when getting to the end, but yummy nonetheless (might be salty for most).  

I guess I am just used to making instant $1 zha jiang mian.  Speaking of which, you will find a grip of variations on this dish, which I am pretty sure is Chinese in origin and literally means fried sauce noodles or something.  I tried a Chinese, Japanese and Korean version of this dish and have a nostalgic value from childhood times.  Some Side dishes would be a good Compliment during lunch since the menu is limited, but there I go again, generalizing Korean cuisine as if banchan is a requirement.  Okay, I'm gonna stop.

Luckily, it appear that the menu is still being tweaked and soon the menu will be expanded to include a larger variety.  Hopefully the location caters to the rush from CSN across the street and I only hope for the best for the owners.  In total honesty, I would have rated my experience with 3 stars since the food was not mind blowing by any means, yet interesting.  I did appreciate the free iced tea that helped wash down the Jajangmyun rather nicely, so that has to be at least a 0.5 star bump, rounding up the rating to 4 stars total.  I believe that the place is very capable of earning a solid 4-5 rating if they keep up the good work and expand the menu.  Only Stone IPA and Fat tire was found on tap and would like to see the selection develop here as well.  Not a big fan of Korean beers.  Too light and bland fire my palette.   So bust out the soju!!!  (last one I swear)
Nice venue, friendly staff, good food. Better ramen than some other Japamese restaurants I've been to.

I looked up the restaurant on Yelp and it had great reviews.  I was excited to eat at the ramen restaurant and arrived 10 minutes before they opened at 11am.  Right before 11am I saw the workers arrive.  I went inside the restaurant and asked if they were open.  A worker responded in 15 minutes they will open. I was hungry and walked around outside with my family for 15 minutes.  I returned to the restaurant after the 15 minutes passed and the door was locked and the lights were still off.  My family and I left upset and hungry.  I strongly recommend that they improve their service or business will be lost.

GREATEST FOOD EVER !! This place has it all the Food, customer service, and the atmosphere is a A+ for me. Ryan the owner of Mokos is a really nice guy and treats his customers very genuinely also his staff too. Definetly a go to place in my book.
We ordered a delivery, when our food arrived, there's 1 Ramen missing, the other ramen we got has missing add ons (boiled egg). The soup taste just okay. Will not order here again.

First time coming here and it was awesome! I ordered the yuzu shio ten and my bf had the curry ramen. I loved my ramen but I loved his more! The staff was super friendly and attentive. Will be coming back again!!
Perfect after school or lunch spot. Unique flavors with healthy options and authentic flavors. The atmosphere is classy without being overpriced.

I am addicted to ramen right now.  Is there a rehab for ramen addiction?  I definitely need an intervention.  I can tell because my ankles are swollen from all the sodium. 

Went on Saturday 6-11-16 at 6PM.  $55.00 got us two ramens, two drinks, a dessert, a salad, and some edamame.  This restaurant is located on Charleston between Jones & Rainbow.  

Our waiter was american and very new and said he had never eaten ramen before he started working there.  WHAT?  Where have you been, mister, under a rock??? When I eat ramen I want some asian lady slingin' noodles at me...it just feels more authentic.  Is that racist? Whatever- the heart wants what it wants.  

I chose to create my own ramen.  They gave me a sheet with all the toppings and a pencil and I just ticked the box next to what I want.  I chose thick noodles, extra noodles, chasu, egg, spinach, and corn.  My creation wound up being $15 which I thought was a little steep.  I really liked the addition of the spinach and overall the broth was pretty tasty although the chasu was small and tough.  

Husband got curry ramen which I thought was brilliant.  I snagged a bite of it and thought it was delicious.  He added chicken katsu to the top which made it perfect.  

I checked in on yelp and scored a free green tea ice cream but they barely gave me half a scoop.  Thanks a lot, ya cheapskates.  I ordered a mont blanc which came out frozen and was pretty gross....I can't recommend it. 

For the price, I'd rather to go Monta or Sora.

I had to find a place to take a group of 21 people recently - it was a dinner with customers for work.... let me tell you - anything over around 11 people becomes a total nightmare - every place I called wanted you to reserve a room and pay up front -  almost like you are doing a rehearsal dinner or something!?!  I was beginning to lose hope that I would find a place that could take our whole group and not cost and arm and a leg!
And THEN I found Ryan and Moko Asian Bistro!  Ryan is the owner and he is amazing - very easy to work with!
The food was absolutely delicious - we tried just about everything on the menu and there wasn't a single thing I wouldn't want to eat again.
I think my favorite would be the "beef taco" - It's really more like a fantastic deconstructed cheeseburger within a light, crunchy wonton bowl.
Thank you again Ryan for making our dinner such a wonderful and memorable evening for both me and my customers!
We will definitely be back next time we are in town :)

Good, not quite great ramen. The broth tastes fresh and not like it's just a package mix. The ingredients were pretty good--the basic mix gets you three thin pieces of pork, with a bit of fat on them (this is a good thing--adds to the flavor of the broth). I didn't get much of the noddles eaten but they tasted well. They were a bit understaffed, I would say, but I would rate this on par with Monta and slightly below Goku. It's a place I would definitely go to again if I was in the area.

If you are looking for bomb ramen, this is the place! My boyfriend and I ate here in December when it had just switched over to this new restaurant. We LOVED it! So I have been a repeat customer :)

The chicken katsu bowl was tender and the katsu sauce was yummy! I ordered the chashu ramen. The broth is rich and flavorful with delicious pieces of chashu pork. I added a soft boiled egg and spicy garlic sauce to the ramen. It was all delicious!

If you are looking for ramen, come to Moko Ramen Bar!

This place has been on my bookmarks for over a year, and I've driven past it several times but never got around to eating here......until last Saturday night.

As usual my timing sucks as I came in 10 minutes after the end of Happy Hour, where all the good starters and tapas are I believe 50% off between 5-7pm. The board with the specials was a bit out of my eyesight range.

Just one guy, the manager I believe, was working the dining area. There were about 4 tables in use out of maybe 10, and a counter space with more seating. So it was kind of quiet. He did a great job hustling taking orders, serving drinks...doing it all with a smile and great attitude and service. 

I had the beef tacos tapa, which is tenderloin bulgogi meat served with a mustard aioli, a lime aioli, and a pear date sauce. This was delicious, with a light shell that didn't cover up the flavors but enhanced them. 5/5

I also had the 30 hour berkshire pork belly. I really enjoyed the flavor of the sweet potato shavings playing off the pork belly and black raspberry sauce. 5/5

Why only 4 stars? Because to get 5 you need to be absolutely fantastic and had I had company and a chance to order more tapas for review I probably would have upgraded. I've become a tough 5 star person, but this was close....very close....4.7

I'll be back to try out some of the other meals,...during happy hour. Prices were fair but what a great deal HH is.

I have only been here twice...5-stars both visits.  Once I came just with my hubby and we had the surf and turf roll (not sure if I'm getting the name exactly right).  Anyway, it was awesome and we also had the pasta with the shrimp.  The flavor on that dish was outstanding.  The only thing I would have done differently is take the tail shell off the shrimp because the sauce was the same color as the shell...not realizing the shell was there, my first bite was a bit crunchy!  I mentioned this to Ryan and he was very gracious with my suggestion, stating he would mention it to the chef.  The second time we went, it was my whole family (hubby plus three teenagers).  I don't know the name of the young lady who was our server but she was a real sweetheart.  When my daughter heard the "Boys Over Flowers" theme song she got very excited...next thing you know, our server was taking specific song requests from my daughter, including K-Pop songs.  It's that kind of personalized service that will always keep me coming back.  The food the second time around was also fantastic and, as usual, Ryan made himself available for questions about the dishes and just to chat.  The place wasn't that busy but it was a Monday and it was Happy Hour.  I think more people should check this place out.  The prices are reasonable, the food is wonderful, and the service is personable.  Thankfully, I work right across the street so I'll be back to check out more Moko dishes!

By far my favorite ramen place! The food is excellent and the potions are perfect! I've never been disappointed from anything I was served. The staff is amazing as well, very polite and not super in your face like many waiters will be at other restaurants. Every ramen lover needs to try this place!

Since a 5 star rating reflects on the quality of the food, I generally start there. The service is so good at Moko that I lead off with props to the owner, Ryan, who greeted me by my name, engaged with us several times throughout our evening, and provided excellent service. He really understands that the front of the house is as important as the meal. He's one of those owners you want to see succeed in a tough business - he's just a really nice guy.!

Moko is cute as hell. Simple, clean - love the artwork. I'll definitely go back for dinner with friends or even to sit at the little bar alone and soak in the ambience.

My Dinner Downtown group enjoyed the 7 Course Tasting Menu. This group is more discriminating than your average group of diners - we seek out the best food and overall experience. 2 chefs and a restaurant owner were in our group; all 10 of us were pleased.

Several dishes really stood out for all of us. The shortrib was incredibly good, and the potato under it was one of my favorites. The pork belly was sinful - a fairly large serving that came alive when dipped in just a smidge of the raspberry salt. The creme brulee was one of the best I've ever tasted, and this is my favorite dessert; the caramel was like glass. Personally, I enjoyed the cold eggplant salad which melted in my mouth.

I read someone's comment that this would be packed every night if it were in a better location. This is true. But it's worth the 25-minute drive from my Henderson office, and I'm looking forward to my next visit. Everyone raves about the shrimp, so that's next up for me.

Will be back to try more items, but I'm sold on the ten hour pork. Don't skip out on the braised shortrib. If you like chicken wings then try the soy wings.
If you don't like mackerel I wouldn't suggest the kimchi pasta. For me it was good but not my favorite.

Catching up on my reviews and I had forgotten to go back to my roots. This Korean tapas-like restaurant is a bit off the best of path from my home route however worth the travel. Ryan the owner is always there which is a huge sign of dedication to the success of this restaurant. My favorite dish is the classic spin on jajangmyun (black bean sauce noodles). But it's hard to pick one favorite when they have dishes such as 30hr sous vide pork belly, and the braised short ribs served on top of a scallop potato stack. The surf and turf roll is a sea bass and bulgogi sushi roll that will bring land and sea harmoniously in each bite and will make your tastebuds go wild. As most people only think of bbq when they think of Korean this place will be sure to give a modern and tasteful spin on Korean flavors and new attributes to the culture.

Was excited to try a new ramen spot as I have my usuals I got to. This place is a joke spent 20 min sitting waiting for someone to bring me water and a menu. Then when one of the two people walk over and we have a question about the bento box he asks if we have a problem to which I say no but we have been waiting almost half an hour without any service. To this he just say oh, at this point my patience has ran out we left and went to jinya ramen which was amazing as always 

Do not visit this joke of a ramen bar

After a long morning in clinic, I dropped by Moko for some fine ramen dining. Hours are listed as 11 am to 10 pm. I arrived at 10:40 am, still closed, no problem. It's now 11:25. Still closed. No signage indicating why it's closed. Website not updated. No answer on the phone. So, why did I wait 45 minutes when I could have driven to Jinya? Regrets, but we all make mistakes in life. I will forever rue this day.

Good food, but wasteful.  If you order a green tea they bring it out in a can and they bring a glass with a straw.  Why? And they use disposable chopsticks.  I dont think i would eat there again because of those reasons.

A solid ramen place. The interior doesn't have the regular rament place look to it because it looks like a regular coffee/bar place. 
We always order the tonkotsu ramen with takoyaki. Their chashu is sometimes too much for me so occasionally I'll do a build your own tonkotsu. Their takoyaki is the best that I've ever had. It is crispy on the outside with soft inside and a big chunk of octopus. Service is usually a little slow but I'm okay with it if I know I will be getting pretty good food for the wait.

I went here looking for something amazing and it came thru I ordered so much everything I had was so good wish I was hungrier for sure I am looking forward to making this my new after school snack place on Thursdays

AMAZING!!! First time here and my girlfriend and I had the Cashu and Fire Ramen w/ added beef bulgogi. Very different dishes but equally delicious. The fire Ramen was a dry Ramen dish with just the right amount of spice. The added beef really made it pop. The Cashu was more traditional and served in a delicious broth. The service was great and Damien impressed with his knowledge and friendliness. We will certainly be going back for seconds!
Very nice restaurant, great service, and excellent food.  I still prefer Monta but this place is near my home so it is a great addition to the neighborhood.

Incredible food and incredible service! I had the curry ramen (with added Japanese sausage), and it was DELICIOUS...flavorful and fresh. I could eat it every day for the rest of my life and be happy...LOL My wife and son had the "make your own" ramen (ramen noodles, chicken base, and chicken katsu), and it was equally delicious. The server was very knowledgeable and answered any questions we had (as well as made some helpful suggestions). We've been there twice and we'll definitely be going back often. It really is that good!

Three things im looking for in a restaurant 1. Customer service 2. Food 3. Clean bathroom. This restaurant have it all!! Ryan was our server... Very professional, always smiling and took care of us. He is so different from the other servers. My wife and I ordered Ramen and Moku bun! You can customize how you want your ramen, you can add toppings on your ramen for additional cost. Moku bun taste like siopao but in a different level! We would come back here again!
